text: I'd love to give Daily Dose 5 stars. Just can't.  The service is too spotty.  One day, service is great, the next it's terrible. Food is consistently very good.  Great for breakfast and lunch with an underrated happy hour.
Good food, good drinks, good service. The soft pretzel bun for the burgers is delicious!

i just want to say that since i moved away from scottsdale I literally daydream about the food at this place.  i am OBCESSED with their housemade veggie burger and pretzel bun and my better half loves a lot of their meatier dishes~ We do miss the RIBS you guys used to have when we are in town. We love that they have one of the best local beers, Orange Blossom from Papago Brewing. You literally can not go wrong at this place...they will have whatever you want and it will be delicious!
The service is always fast, staff is friendly, and the food is fantastic!!!!!!!  Love this place. Steak and eggs was perfect.

My hubby had the flannel hash... AMAZING. I had the cilantro, jalapeño hummus for an appetizer (my hubby doesn't even like hummus but he liked this) so good! And for my meal I got the tacos with Chicken! YUM-O
I had a breakfast dish and loved it.  Another time I had a salad and it was spinach and dressing.

I can't understand how this place gets good reviews.  I ordered salmon which came with an Asian slaw type thing and I ordered a side salad as well.  The side salad, in complete disregard to it's name, arrived 10 minutes before the food.  Fair enough, I'm still getting used to American dining practices but it made for an awkward moment with the person I was eating with as they had no side dish to arrive early and stare at...Anyway, when the food arrived I genuinely couldn't taste the difference between the salmon and the vegetables, so bland was the flavor of each.  A restaurant that can't make fish and carrot taste different from each other simply can't be good, right?

Little else compares to Sunday brunch with friends!  Simply put, this is a great spot! The food was great, the service was great, and prices were comparable to other restaurants. I usually enjoy a bloody mary with Sunday brunch, but I think my expectations were a little too high. My all time favorite is that of Orange Table. I went for the Bacon Bloody Mary and would not repeat. I would definitely return for the food.  I ordered the Flannel Hash which was YUMMY. Friends ordered oatmeal, pancakes, and the benedict. All were amazing! It was well worth the 20 minute wait for a table.

Called while in the parking lot Sunday around 1130 and asked if there was a wait. Was told no wait. Walked in and they told us it was a 30+ minute wait. Seems like a policy of lying about wait time to get you in the door.

I love this place.the food and the staff are exceptional. I eat here most days for lunch and always feel like a very welcomed guest. My favorites are the lox and bagel(and im from nyc) the open face roasted turkey sandwich is delicious as well as the stuffed portobello mushroom egg white   dish. Thanks kaylee,sylvia,jessica,alan and the gagg for making every visit end with a smile. With hugs-mark w

Love this place lots of interesting twist to normal breakfast items. It takes you a while ti decide what to get because everything is good. Great lattes and love the pig and bagel. Definitely recommend for breakfast!!

Absolutely love this place, especially with the new menu additions. One of the best burgers I've ever had! Also the onion rings, mahi mahi tacos, and chicken pasta are fantastic. Customer service is awesome, and the decor is beautiful

Well, overall I have to give this place 3 stars.  We usually go for breakfast and try to sit on the patio as it seems less noisy.  A pet peeve of mine is not writing down my order and then not serving me what I ordered.  This has happened several times here where my order was not prepared as I had ordered it.  That being said, the breakfast nachos are probably the best thing I've had there. My husband loves the prime rib and eggs. We eat out alot and are always looking for a good breakfast place.

Very disappointing. I ordered the "Pigs In A Bagel" (Two eggs, peppered bacon & tomato topped with cheddar, served on your choice of bagel with herb potato & fresh fruit) and I also asked the waitress "how do the EGGS come?" And she said "scrambled" so I just thought it was going to be a bagel, with scrambled eggs, slices of bacon on top, tomato, and topped with the cheddar cheese. I get my "sandwich" and it's a little squished bagel with a gross omelette inside with tiny bits of bacon and tomato, like a drop of some white cheese, and some wilted lettuce, really un satisfying. The booth we were sitting at was so freezing that our food was cold within 5 minutes. The manager offered to get me something else so I just asked for a mixed berry smoothie to  go to play it safe. I thought it tasted kind of milky so I opened the lid and there was a huge pile of whip cream, yuck. Since when do breakfast sandwiches come with lettuce and smoothies come with whipped cream? Very strange. Our waitress also seemed like she could care less about us and I think we were there for almost 2 hours, super slow and ridiculous. Don't think I'll be going back there.

So many choices! Perfect for a group where some may want a breakfast item and some may want lunch. Homemade lemonade is perfect, not too sweet. Loved the banana bread french toast as well. My group didn't really love the DD hash but the meal itself was filling.

This is my favorite restaurant in Old Town. The food is great, the prices are reasonable, and the atmosphere is great. Very chill vibe. I eat there at least once a month and the staff is always friendly. I love to take family and friends there. Everyone I have brought with me loves it.
Went here for breakfast on the way out of town.  Very nice.  I had the biscuit and gravy which was very tasty.  The gravy actually had a sweetness to it.  Loves the potatoes and onions.  Good coffee.

In town for a wedding and thank you Yelp for this gem of a place!! Service, coffee, and food were all nothing shy of amazing. I had an iced almond milk latte, the espresso was delicious! Mom and I both got the two eggs with turkey sausage, fruit, and upgraded to the mixed berry protein pancakes. Easily the best pancakes I've ever had!   Turkey sausage was very tasty. The fruit mix was super ripe and delicious. Dad got the two eggs with turkey sausage, sourdough toast, and potatoes. The seasoning on the potatoes was delish. I would be here all the time if I lived here!! If I'm ever in Scottsdale again, I will be back!!
It gets a little busy on the weekends but the Hangover Breakfast Sandwich with butternut squash hash is just Fantastic!  We will be back again.

Has become a weekend staple for breakfast or brunch, as the line out the door has shown increased patronage.  Most things on the menu are in the $10 range, whether breakfast or lunch.  DD has a great urban feel to the decor and lots of happy hour specials.  I'm a fan of the Daily Dose burger as you don't have to add ketchup or mustard.  The nachos are monstrous and glad to see a place still serve fruit as a side.

The menu is pretty amazing, lot's of stuff I want to come back and try! Seems like they have a lot of drink specials too!  Had the Naked French Toast, the side of acorn squash was a bit odd, would love to see some regular hash browns on the menu. The pricing is pretty decent and the staff are pretty nice (a bit slow) but nice. Definitely a place to just come and hang.
Great place for a breakfast meeting.   Breakfast Nachos are solid!
I really use to love this place but it is just not the same  Prices increased happy hour bites and the hours keep changing. Just don't trust you anymore
One of the best breakfast I've had. Period! Black Forest ham omelette with Poblanos holy poo!! So fricken Great

The Banana Bread French Toast and Black Forest Ham Eggs Benedict with DD Hash was excellent. The service was right on and the price was just right. I will be back! Thank you for making my weekend better.
Cute little place. Hummas with edamame was different. Calamari steak appetizer was tender but lack taste. Will return to try more.

I went here for lunch last week and had the most amazing turkey burger!!  There is a hint of sage that marries perfectly with the airy crispiness of the pretzel bun.  Their pomegranate green iced tea is also refreshing and delicious.  They even give you a to-go cup!

So far, this place serves the best breakfast I have had in Scottsdale. Nice menu. I had the Southwest Flannel Hash AND the Banana Nut Bread French Toast (I thought my friends would try some of the French Toast, I was wrong). Both portion sizes were quite adequate for most appetites. Both were also fantastic. I'm going into a food coma. Service (Miranda, if I'm not mistaken) was quick and friendly. Despite a full restaurant and bar, our food didn't take long at all to come out. I will definitely be back.

My dinner experience here was ok, but breakfast here is where it's at! Some very guilty-pleasure french toast and pancake choices. The Benedict was very good - really good sauce, a must for Beni's. My new fave breakfast spot since Orange Table moved to Tempe.

AMBIANCE:  Trendy - Urban - Upscale Casual (small tho' - between inside & patio, only seats 99 total). Very nice modern decor - tables made of white agate suspended in some sort of lucite. Nice art on walls. Good size booths.  FOOD:  We had the famous pretzel bun burger w/fries and the Ancho Chile Reuben w/combo fries. Both were totally De-Lish!  The bacon on the burger was 100% real and cooked on a grill, just like home.  Also the red pepper aioli and bits of basil leaf added a subtle new flavor to the same ol'burger.  Burger was cooked as ordered: a beautiful med. rare.  The Ancho Chile Reuben was HUGE!  Tasty with only a hint of zing.  Crispy fries rounded out the huge plates & portions are large so come hungry (combo fries are the crispy fries and sweet potato fries mixed in together- great for sharing).  We had tea as a beverage - fresh brewed and excellent.  SERVICE:  Everything was great -with one exception:  our waiter never asked us if we wanted more tea.  He was back several times - asked if we wanted dessert, etc.  He was nice, friendly, pleasant & accomodating when we needed an extra minute to decide on our order. But, not offering a refill on the drinks (the glasses were empty before our plates were) made a difference for us in the tip:  would have been 20% but instead left only about 16%.  OVERALL:  We did not have a long wait time as others described.  May be because we were there at 3:45 p.m. on a weekend and not a busy meal hour during the work week. Food was absolutely excellent and we will definitely be back - gotta try the Breakfast Nachos!

I'm picky about where I'll drink black coffee, and prices and atmospheres don't sway me. I've been to no-nonsense coffeehouses that charge $2.25 for delicious coffee and I've been to stuffy hipster joints that charge $6 for a small black coffee that tastes how I imagine mud would taste, and I don't go back. I'll go back to Daily Dose. It's surprisingly tasty for being so trendy. I actually think the cream ruined it. The food is great too. I got a crabby omelette with a side of fruit and it was really good. I thought I was making a mistake by going on a late Sunday morning for brunch, but they actually got us a table pretty quickly (like within three minutes) and our server was a really nice guy. I was really happy with my experience and I can't wait to go back. If it were in my budget, I'd make it a weekend tradition!
Best breakfast and coffee around. Made only better by the friendly staff and fantastic food and drink options available. I will be back next time I am in town.

This is one of those great quite places that you can have a morning meeting in or just relax and enjoy your day.  The food is always great. The service is some of the best that you can ask for. I love the corn beef and fried egg as well as the biscuits and gravy. Oh and lets not forget the coffee I would go there just for a cup of coffee and a quite place to read a book. If you are looking for a good morning out with amazing breakfast look no further.
I went on a weekend, so the wait was long. I had a bfast burrito which was pretty good, and I ordered a bloody mary that was ok.
Food and service were great.  Staff very helpful with local tourist spots and coffee to go.  Kid friendly.
Great place for breakfast. Sat at the bar with Kyle as our server. If you are in scottsdale this is the place to eat breakfast.
Had the Caesar salad with chicken.  Dressing was bland. Service is good..nice atmosphere.

I would definitely recommend trying the salmon omelet with DD hash as the side.  The berry protein pancakes are also a must!  The prices were really great; we had a salmon omelet, veggie omelet, and two side pancakes for only $30.
My husband and I had a great lunch here.  Very tasty and interesting combinations of ingredients.  Great service from Brenna, too!  Looking forward to our next visit.

I eat here regularly and I have to say, the place never disappoints. The staff is always friendly and the food is delicious. The Straight Shooter with buttermilk pancakes, scrambled eggs and sausage is my favorite. The signature cocktails have real fruit in them and happy hour includes a big food menu.   I know for a while the wait times were lengthy but the added dining room fixed that. We hardly ever have to wait for a table at lunch time. I would definitely recommend!
Excellent food and good service. Had takeout dinner with salads and entrees. Both were excellent especially the salad. Will return soon for the happy hour.

Honestly not much to write here. Food was okay. Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either.   Service was okay - sat at the bar with what appeared no designated waitress which made things a little more difficult - was never checked on and had to ask for coffee.

This is our second year in a row eating at Daily Dose. We loved it so much, we ate 2 of our 3 breakfasts here this Spring Training trip. Last year, we ate there on our last day in town. Several things make this an outstanding breakfast/lunch spot. First, they use fresh ingredients & make many of their own products. For example, when you ask for jam, they bring out house jam, not the usual packets. Second, the menu is interesting & varied. We thought we could probably eat there for a week & not repeat a meal. Third, portions are big and satisfying. If you walk out hungry, I would wonder about you - seriously! My son is a big eater & he couldn't finish his plate (granted he was noshing off my plate & sharing part of a pancake with his dad), but still...They have GF pancakes & what they call "stuffed" pancakes. The cinnamon roll pancake (not GF) was awesome according my guys. Omelets are 3-egg served w/ potatoes, fruit & toast. The variety is good. I loved the Chile Verde & peppered bacon omelets. Both were great, plus they note on menu which items are GF. My son had corn pancakes with chorizo which he loved. He also liked the Hangover Sandwich. Be warned: there will be a wait if you go during normal breakfast hours. It can go over an hour at times. They serve free coffee & water while you wait & have some chairs in front. Wait staff is friendly & helpful.

I came in and had the Stack. I don't eat meat very often, especially not at restaurants, but the idea of a french dip-esque sandwich appealed to me.  The roast beef tasted cheap, and it tasted microwaved. You know the fatty, tendony, bland taste that cheap meat offers? This sandwich sat in my stomach like a grease ball. The regular french fries were tough--don't even know how it is possible for fries to be tough unless they were stale or old or something.   There was absolutely nothing memorable about this sandwich whatsoever. The menu is pretty unimaginative and the vegetarian options were pretty poor. Wow, ANOTHER restaurant that has a portabella mushroom sandwich for vegetarians? Pinch me.   The tomatoes on my sandwich were crunchy and still green, I am not even joking.   Finally, the pretzel bread which was supposed to be amazing tasted like every other enriched-white bread roll I have ever had. There was nothing memorable about it at all and I was frankly puzzled by the enthusiastic response to it.  Hint: The prices are affordable because they order the cheapest produce, and cheap nasty meat. I came to a restaurant for a sandwich because I wanted something more exciting than packaged deli meat from the grocery store could offer. I failed, and won't be coming back here ever again.

Sat out on the patio. It was packed but the atmosphere was awesome and so was the cool breeze. Service was prompt and helpful, but not overly so. We had chips and salsa as an appetizer. The salsa had great flavor. For the main course we had fish and chips. It was average and nothing spectacular but no complaints on my end. Happy hour is from 4-8pm and had great deals, very affordable.

Delicious! The honey wheat pancakes tasted amazing! Eggs were cooked perfectly. Sausage was yummy. My cappuccino was great! Our waiter Spencer was accommodating and friendly. We sat outside which was breezy and comfortable. Overall great brunch! Would highly recommend.

I couldn't rave about this place enough!! I loved this place so much that I went back 2 times!! The outdoor seating is beautiful and the waitress and waiter that I had were so extremely nice. Each time I went, I got the strawberry creme brûlée waffles (I think they're called). These are amazing waffles with piles of strawberries and a smooth cream sauce drizzled over it with a helping of whipped cream on top! Yum! It's so great that it doesn't even need syrup. The first time I went, it was a Saturday and it was about 11:00 AM. Although there were people lined up outside waiting for tables, they got people in very quickly. I believe, that we waited about 15-20 minutes for a table of 4. That was nothing considering they have a nice seating area outside of the restaurant. I couldn't be happier with this lovely restaurant!

I don't go out for breakfast often, so when I do, I want it to be goooood...Daily Dose lived up to all of my expectations. They have so many options, but we went with the eggs benedict with turkey sausage and the berry protein pancakes. Both were absolutely delicious - the hollandaise on the benedict was tasty and light, while the turkey sausage was super flavorful with a tiny bit of spice. The berry protein pancakes seem like they'd be too healthy to also be delicious, considering they're made with honey wheat batter and protein flax seed granola, but they're amazingly good...I wish all things so healthy could taste so good. Service was terrific - prompt and friendly. With The Breakfast Club just up the street, Old Town is lucky to have two great breakfast spots!

What a great place to turn your happy hour into dinner! Small plates make a great meal at prices under $7. One of the best places in Old Town where you can split a bottle of wine for $17.50, grab a few apps and be on your way for under $30! The service is always fantastic, the atmosphere is poppin!  Don't be afraid to bring your kids either - the menus is full of great choices and they'll keep busy with Rylan's puzzles.  Love this place!

Daily Dose has disappointed me a few times in the past; however, the food is NEVER one of the reasons. Service has been spotty (long wait times for intro/drinks, mid-meal, or bill time), no ice in drink or maybe a spot on a fork (immediate replacement with apologies and smiles)...but every single time I have been there, I was greeted at some point by the owner, and the food was ALWAYS consistently superior to any other breakfast place in Scottsdale. That is the one reason I continually come back. If they mess up my coffee, I know they will replace it with a smile and a meaningful apology. But if I order a turkey sausage omelet with DD hash on the side, it will always be delicious and spot on with no issues whatsoever.
Love coming here for there veggie burger it is amazing. Services is always great and it is not to loud. Great place to grab a bite and visit with friends.

They had several craft beers on tap.  Very good selection.  I went during their happy hour, kobe beef hamburger $3 off.  Pretzel bun, awesome food and atmosphere.  Definitely will go back and try some other food on their menu.  My service was excellent and food delivered quickly.

I have been here no less than five times since discovering this place on Mother's Day.  At one point I had been 4 weeks in a row.  Of the five times I've been here, I've eaten breakfast four times and lunch once.  The first time we came with at least 8 people.  This was a bit of a problem, because they only have one area where they can seat a group of more than 4.  We didn't mind waiting though.  Second time, same scenario, but we were treated to an order of the breakfast nachos for having to wait so long.  Thumbs up for the management.  Third time with a group, no nachos and still a good wait.  Overall I'd say be prepared to wait if you are dining with a crowd, but it's worth it.   I consider myself a breakfast connoisseur, and I can honestly say this is one of my favorite places in the central phoenix/scottsdale area.  I've had the following:  Blueberry Ginger French Toast (wonderful, loved it) PB & J Waffle (x3, my favorite item on the menu) Grilled Cheese (great for lunch, fries are also tasty)  Side of bacon (phenomenal) Side of sausage (just the way I like it) Side of sourdough toast (crispy, but not burned)  I still haven't tried the pancakes, but I think that's next on the list.  They have a beautiful patio, so when the weather cools down again, I'll be sure to dine al fresco.

Sunday morning breakfast was a treat today. For starters parking was easy and convenient. They had a good crowd but no wait. Walked right in and was greeted by a friendly hostess. Got seated right away at bar. Service was prompt and server was attentive and knowledgeable. However I did have to ask fir the check. Quality of food was better than I expected. Got crab omelette....being from maryland im a crab cake snob but these were good. Could have used some old bay..whole grain toast was thick cut and fresh..appreciated butter and jam in metal ramikins and not packets. Jam was amazing...I also got to sit next to the most important man in the world who felt the need to interrupt the server EVERY time she came over to me. Server was patient and I believe this guy might be in need of mental help. But I digress..price was good for the value..I will be back and cant wait to try lunch..
The service was excellent the atmosphere was nice and congenial. But the food was fantastic the pancakes with bacon and everything about it was delicious! Oh and the coffee was great too!

Loved the place. Had the Turkey White-out. Yummer!  We will be back for dinner or lunch.  But they are really busy and the servers have a hard time keeping up but I think but they did their best. We drove from the NW  valley ! They were worth the trip.
The best appetizers and salads in old town!  Try the citrus salad with grilled chicken.  Great service, not pretentious or stupid people around either, nice, huh!?
Breakfast was amazing. Huge portions, you can definitely share a plate if you are like me that eats light breakfast. The service was great and the atmosphere was inviting. I highly recommend.

Every now and then I stumble across something that blows me away, and believe me when I say, "This place did just that".  I live in the far southeast valley and rarely get to Scottsdale. WELL, That was before I had breakfast at Daily Dose. I had the Smokey Stuffed Portabella Mushroom and my daughter had the Chorizo omelet. This little gem offers something different and exciting for every palate. If in the area...Or not, Make a point to stop in. You'll be so glad you did.
Food is okay, but WORSE SERVICE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!! The management sucks, as well as the servers. Also the place is veryyyy dirty. I would not eat there!!!!!!!
the food is consistently good and so is the coffee.  i have yet to find a better breakfast place.

It is our first time visiting this place. We arrived at around noon, we waited for about 20 minutes for an outdoor table. We didn't mind waiting because they offer self-serving regular coffee, iced coffee and cucumber water just outside the main entrance.  Our name was called and Jeanine care of us (which did an amazing job as our server!) and decided to have Crab Cake Eggs Benedict and Banana Bread French Toast.  Both our plates were delicious and so was their coffee (which we're told is from a local company).  We'll definitely come back!
Been here a few times, mostly has not lived up to the hype.  Decent food but it's hit and miss.  Long wait on the weekends.

This is the kind of place I want near my house until I think about how often I'd like to be there. There is a very varied menu and everything is top notch and a very good value. The staff is nice and friendly and there's an outdoor patio with misters. I can't say enough about the corned beef hash, so incredibly tasty and a sizable portion. Love this place!

I was looking for another awesome breakfast restaurant apart from T.C. Eggingtons and found the Daily Dose.  I have been here a handful of times and loved everything I have got! Great place for mimosas and breakfast food!

Great place with lots of options (breakfast, lunch or dinner). Good, consistent staff. Sometimes there's a relatively long wait, but that has improved greatly since they expanded. Favorite drink: sangria margarita swirl (it's REALLY good!!) Would definitely recommend if you're in the area!

Awesome!! The menu is great. Good choices for cocktails and coffee drinks. I had the polenta poblano Benedict and it was delicious. Also had the cinnamon roll pancake, it was very sweet but very good. Such a fluffy pancake. My boyfriend had the huevos rancheros. His eggs were over cooked and the beans were under cooked. But at least that means they cook the beans rather than get them from a can. And he still enjoyed his meal and we still give the place 5 stars.

Despite the long wait to be seated on the weekends, my group waited even longer for our food making our Daily Dose experience just over 2 hours. Breakfast is legit, their staff on this visit was not. After 3,600 seconds, or one hour, our vacant server informed us the 'kitchen' had lost our ticket.
If you like Denny's then you've found the right place! Food was horrible. Ate 3 bites and couldn't stomach the rest. Staff was pleasant. Unfortunately would never go back.

Not quite a five-star rating, but I ate here Wednesday and the hostess/waitress was nice, the food was served promptly. I was there for happy hour, which I found to be quite a bargain - much appreciated these days. The chorizo mac and cheese was inventive and provided a nice creamy flavour with just a hint of of spice. My friend ordered a salad, which she seemed to enjoy. As appetizers were half price during happy hour I figured I ought try another appetizer, and got the meatballs marinara. That was decent as well, though the bread gets a little soggy in the marinara sauce. Dos XX beer was $3, so an affordable afternoon out. Would have appreciated some German beer though - am getting tired of the Mexican/American beer dichotomy at so many restaurants.   Happy hour even extends to 8pm. All-in-all, I was happy my friend recommended this place.
Great food (the chorizo omelet is excellent). The staff is very friendly - ask to sit in Ryan's section. Will come back next year!

Went there after work with friends for dinner and happy hour.  The food and drinks were quite good, and our waiter was super friendly.   A nice, clean little place with a mellow atmosphere.  Ill be back.
Great breakfast;  omelets, chorizo, pancakes, etc.  We had a great meal and a cool atmosphere.

We love the daily dose! The atmosphere is always casual and welcoming.  We had brunch this morning, and our service from Brenna was wonderful, as always. The service is great, and the food is divine.  I recommend anything off the "Health Nut" menu for breakfast... healthy AND delicious. And, don't forget dinner... Green Chili Chicken Enchiladas -- yum!

I went for breakfast today and I'm already wanting to go back for lunch and dinner. The 4 of us ordered: 2 orders of eggs Benedict, 2 orders of side biscuits and gravy, a gingerbread pancake, a pb&j waffle, a gladiator burger, and a protein & iron breakfast. Can you believe we ate it all? Seriously, no leftovers and they were huge portions! The waitresses checked on us numerous times with sincerely friendly, smiling faces and made sure the food got to us super fast and hot. I am beyond impressed with how well this place has their service figured out and the design is beautiful! I honestly can't think of one single thing that is wrong with Daily Dose.
Great breakfast spot but be sure to come ealry or be ready for the wait.

I'm completely astonished by the positive reviews!  My family and I went here this evening because we had been to the one in Phoenix and were pleased but I cannot stress enough the terrible experience we had.  The waitress forgot to put in an order and we were almost done before the meal came.  She never once came to explain or apologize and an apology would have gone a loooong way.  She basically ignored us from then on - put on your big girl panties and deal with it.  We asked for the manager who was either ignorant or arrogant but regardless his lack of managerial skills, social skills and communication skills simply made the entire situation worse. We explained we were there for a celebration and were told we would be given a dessert.  A different waiter attempted to put the dessert down on our dirty table because no one could be bothered to clear it...really????  So WE cleared our table , so that he could put it down and did we then get utensils to eat the dessert?  Nope.  The original waitress finally reappeared to see if everything was ok - seriously?  Were you on vacation the past hour?  And then on our bill we were charged for the long awaited meal and the dessert we were told was to be on the house.  Again, the manager with the seriously deficient intelligence ignored us - did he go to the same school of stupidity the wait staff attended?  And then he kept us waiting even longer for the new bill, which was a complete joke.  The food was average but I'm guessing the reason it was so completely dead in there on a Sat. night in Scottsdale is because the manager and staff are inept, rude and pathetically incompetent.  Oh, but thanks to the really brilliant waitress who gave the scotch to the 17 year old!  And the IQ points just kept continue to drop....
Should always come to this location. Best food and service. Can really make a girl happy here. Their other location needs to learn a little something something from here.

Our waiter Adam was great. There was no wait when we arrived at 8am on a Thursday morning. The food was very good too. We ordered the green chili pork omelette, huevos rancheros, eggs benedict tostada, and a peaches & cream pancake.
Amazing menu, service, atmosphere, and food! I had the Gingerbread Latte and Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict! If you are a smoked salmon fan, definitely get this :)

DD is a great HH spot in Old Town, especially when you're looking something a little more hearty or quality to eat (ahem, Bungalow, Salty's, Loco and other mediocre to poor food offenders).  DD's rating is a huge beneficiary of my love for fantastic beer on tap, and offers up 5 great microbrews....including an IPA *drooling*.  The food is good to very good, and the only complaint I have is pretzel dough on a hamburger is just way too heavy!  The burger itself is fantastic.  On my first trip, they were woefully understaffed which = bad service and angry Little Lady, but my last visit was much better and our server was cheerful, attentive, and split the check 300 ways as we had a large party.  Any server that can smile while trying to handle that math deserves a hefty tip.  The patio sits right on Scottsdale Rd (as do most establishments adjacent to the road) but it's not too noisy.  HH goes until 8, and with an eclectic mix of cocktails, beer, and wine, there is something for everyone.  Looking forward to breakfast at the Dose!

For breakfast this is one of the best places to eat in Scottsdale. Everything is good.  Service was great. They do give you way to much food, i would reccomending splitting something.   Breakfast Nachos, Peanut Butter N Jelly Waffles, Biscuits N Gravy, or the Omelettes

I love this place. Good food regardless of what time you go but breakfast is definitely the time they shine. I get French toast when I go but for lunch I got the Mac and Cheese for lunch.    Great service and great food

This was my 2nd visit at the Daily Dose, both are on Saturdays, both are for brunch, and both times the wait was about 20 mins. You know it is a popular brunch place, and of course in a good location as well. However, as the services were pretty slow for both times and the food did not 'wow' me at neither times, I just have to give an average ratings...   What I like on both tries? The orange juice! Yes, it was fresh and delicious! The Prime Rib omelette was pretty good as well, especially if you add a few drops of Tabasco for a spicy hint, it just tasted better! However, what I did not like, the Smoked Salmon Egg Benedict... The dish arrived kinda cold, feels like it was sitting on the counter longer that it should have, the english muffin was over-toasted which it became hard to cut,  the poached eggs were not done so well (i think they were too flat by the shape?), and there was too much of the Hollandaise sauce on the top and it just stole the taste of the smoked salmon... how I wish it was better.  If you are in the area and look for a place for breakfast/brunch, Daily Dose is still a good choice, just be prepared for a wait on the weekend and avoid the Egg Benedict?

The places looks good, there's a line out the door, but they are cheap on bacon for the BLT sandwich. It had two pieces total for the entire sandwich. When I ordered extra bacon it cost $3.54, for three pieces of bacon. Not happy that a BLT now cost me $13.53. To the manager, please Don't be cheap with the bacon, it makes your nice restaurant low end.   On the positive side I had the burger and it was very tasty. My wife did like her BLT, but  won't order it again. I would have given this place 4 stars if not for the bacon.

I love this place... loved it better when nobody else knew about it!  Breakfast is always excellent.  Banana Bread French Toast (I'm not F'n with you) nuff said!!!  Happy hour menu is great too, try the calamari with the red sauce.  The Burgers and sandwiches are great too!  Hard to go wrong at the Daily Dose.

This was the first place I dined out at when I moved to the Scottsdale area two year ago and it still to this day ceases to amaze me. Every dish I've ever had for every meal: breakfast, lunch, or dinner has been delicious and satisfying. I recommend the breakfast nachos for groups at brunch, the hangover sandwich for the hungry meat eating man, and the decadent banana nut French toast for those with a sweet tooth. Consistently high quality coffee which they dispense liberally as well!

Love this place!  The food is delicious and the service is great; the staff are so friendly!  The Manager stopped by to ask how our meal was going which I thought was a really nice touch.  They also have TVs so you can watch the game if you want.  The place is spacious with enough seating; we've never had to wait for a table, even during peak brunch time, which is great.  I highly recommend this place for brunch.

Gave two stars only because of the manager at this place..  Came here for breakfast with my boyfriend.  Food and service were good. So for lunch we decided to come back here and brought our kids with us. Everything was going well.. until I saw a little spider in my salad :) (and it didn't upset me at all being honest.. If I found something like a hair or nail or a cockroach it'd be disgusting. But tiny spider.. well it's hot in Arizona, all these insects are everywhere, it's not great but what can you do) So I didn't even want to tell about that to a manager but kids did. And his reaction was interesting.. He didn't believe me. He asked me like ten times if I'm sure it was a spider, if I'm sure it was in my salad, if I'm sure I really saw it. Like really?!  In a situation like this a wise manager would just apologize and would take this item out of a check. But this manager said because I already ate big part of the salad he'd take only part of the price out of the check.  Like really?!  Whatever...  On a bright side the place is good, they bring you water with cucumber in it, very refreshing . The rest of our food was pretty good.

Eat at Daily Dose two times a week, food is great and staff is very friendly. Really enjoy the omelettes. My friend ordered biscuits and gravy he said they were the best. Sit at the bar and you will meet very interesting people with great stories. I am always  willing to move over a chair, it's just courteous and the polite thing to do.

Have eaten here before, never any issues.  Ordered take out today, Grilled chicken on pretzel bun and iced tea.   The Desert Rose tea was really good, however the grilled chicken was very bland and the worst part was the chicken was so tough that it ended up getting wasted.  Out $14.    Should've gone to Gelato and Pizza Spot, their sandwiches are delicious (and less expensive). And their fountain drinks and iced tea are under $2!!

Hands down, the BEST breakfast/brunch spot in Scottsdale, quite possibly the entire valley (I'd even take it as far as "Best of AZ").   Every single item is delicious, my husband isn't big on breakfast foods and he loves this place.  Fantastic way to kick off your Sunday Funday, boozy brunches don't get any better than this!

The food was excellent and very good quality.  The service was good too.  If you are looking for specialty waffles and pancakes this is the place to come.  They have a decent amount of gluten free options as well.  If you have a big party I probably wouldn't recommend coming here bc when we tried to call and make reservations we found out that they do not take reservations. The place seems to always be busy so I just don't foresee it being a good place for a party bigger than probably six individuals. It's sad bc I would love to be able to bring bigger parties here but until I can make a reservation I do not feel comfortable. Overall this is a good restaurant and the food is excellent!

The best breakfast in Scottsdale, hands down.  Some favs:  Banana Bread french toast, gingerbread peach pancakes, breakfast nachos, biscuits and gravy, the hangover sandwich, giant omelettes and excellent coffee.  You can't go wrong with this place.
Great breakfast...homemade turkey sausage will bring a smile to any carnivores face!  Fruit cup crisp and fresh...home fries packed with a lot of flavor!! Hot chocolate was a bit weak on the flavor.

My friends and I were in town for Spring Training and were looking for breakfast place walking distance to the stadium.  DD caught my eye on N. Scottsdale Rd. since it was bustling with action.  Tired and slighty hungover we gave it a shot and were pleasantly surprised with the food.  I thought the food was good and the service was very good.  Attentive server who as friendly and got our day off to a good start.  One thing I can't be sure of is if the Spring Training crowd slowed the kitchen down.  The food did take over 20-25 min to come out but when your having a bloody mary and trying to remember things from the past night that wait goes by fast!

Probably mine & my bf's 7th time frequenting this establishment. From the mixed berry protein waffle to the chorizo eggs benedict this place is a must for breakfast. Yeh, you should really try the last. If you like chorizo you will surely enjoy the benedict dish. My bf always gets the breakfast nachos which I have to say are pretty darn yummy! The nachos consist of chorizo, egg, tomatoes...and all kinds of good stuff.  Plus for us that they allow dogs on the patio. Most the time it is a bit tight with our 2 dogs on a busy weekend but today (sunday) we arrived at 7 a.m. and had the patio to ourselves.  Service is at a decent pace any faster and I would feel rushed. Any slower and I would give this place 4 stars.  Servers are friendly enough.  We have also been here for lunch which is just as nice with good options. I had a strawberry chicken salad, tasty. Only complaint chicken was on the dry side.   Overall, DD is consistent and that I like. We know we can expect yumminess every time we visit.

Wow. Where do I begin..? We went there last weekend with 12 people for a bachelorette brunch. We had spoken to a manager weeks before because they didn't take reservations but were told they could accommodate a big party if we were to get there a little early. The day of, I called and they said to come in 20-30 min before to set it up.I got there 40 minutes before the rest of the guests were to arrive. When I got there, they said they had filled up and was going to have to wait...so I waited..and then waited...I waited for an hour an a half. I kept checking in with the hostess and "manager" who were super rude and kept telling me to wait. Our entire party arrived and we were still waiting. My sister told the manager that the hostess was very rude and he didn't seem to care. They were pretty terrible. Finally, we got seated. We ordered our food, all the food came out except for mine and my sisters (thankfully not the bride) and we waited...everyone finished with their meals and ours was still not there. Finally it showed up, and guess what? A hair in my sisters food! The waitress didn't seem very apologetic but they didn't charge us. Just for our coffee, which I thought was lame too. It wAs a pretty awful experience and we won't be going back. Thanks a lot daily dose for ruining a bachelorette brunch with your rude service!

Whether its a happy hour outing or a hung over brunch this place never disappoints. I like how there is a cucumber in the water and the wait staff is always very friendly! The portion sizes are pretty huge so depending on how hungry you are, you can take home some left overs!

What a really pleasant surprise!  We stopped by for a late lunch on a Friday afternoon.  We had no great expectations and as we were walking in the downtown area of old Scottsdale decided to have lunch at The Daily Dose.  We never heard of it or about it before, but their menu looked interesting.  WOW, we were blown away!  The chef at this restaurant really knows what they are doing.  Our meals were the SW Chicken Salad and the Po-Boy (chicken) with a chef salad.  The flavors, freshness, taste, and portion sizes were excellent.  Be sure to try the "crispies" (cheese bread) that comes with the salad.  It is awesome.  The overall value was OK too.  Two of us plus coffee for both came to about $30.  The service was very good as well.  Do not pass this one up, if you get a chance to eat here.  You will not be disappointed, for sure.

Always quick and amazing service! Foods delicious for me (vegetarian) and my friend! Never had a bad experience there! Wish id been there for happy hour more often. Love it! Always the best breakfast in town! :)

The food was excellent- P B and J waffle w compote and the Hangover sandwich. But the service was terrible , too many servers trying to service Everyone With no coordination between them. It took way too long-  they brought the wrong coffee and then replaced it w the correct one and charged for both . Manager was too busy trying to explain the mistakes away instead of acknowledging the problems and apologizing  or god forbid comping us for the coffee. Too bad the service seriously detracted from the creativity and qualitivity of the food . Won 't be back.

Good food and good prices don't make up for slow service.  We decided to go to Daily Dose only because we saw they had outdoor dog-friendly seating. The hostess said the wait time would be about 20 minutes. After about 10 mins of waiting, we saw a bunch of tables open up, yet nobody was being seated. After another 20 minutes of waiting,I asked the hostess how much longer it would be before we would be seated, she said another 10 minutes at least. The table we were eventually seated at had been empty for a good 15 minutes. Meanwhile, half of the other patio tables are empty as well... Slowly the hostess seated some of the other waiting customers.  Our waitress was very nice and pleasant. She recommended a delicious berry sangria which was amazing... We were later surprised to find that the sangria cost only $4... We decided to stay for another glass once we saw the check.  The food tasted good. Hefty portions and delicious turkey sausage. Now, I'm not much of a sausage eater but this was some darn good sausage.  I went to the bathroom and eavesdropped on some other customers who were complaining about the really slow service. I didn't pay much attention to it because they seemed like the whiney complaining type.    I would recommend this place if you have endless amounts of patience for the slow service. At the end of the day, the food was good. Bonus points for allowing dogs outside.  However, we contemplated leaving before we were seated because of the idiot hostess. She made my blood boil.

Ate here after reading about the burgers on pretzel buns.  It was every bit as delicious as I imagined.  I was disappointed when I read that on Fridays, burgers are half off, but when I asked the server she stated that that was only after 4pm.  I wished they had advertised that little bit of info too.  The crispy fries were delish as well.  Loved that pretzel bun.  Will go back for that for sure.
Had lunch on our quick tour through town. Service was good - food was great. Loved the Caesar portabella mushroom wrap. Good beers - wish we would have tried the bacon bloody Mary!
Always on a wait. Always waiting on an ardent server to take your order. Always has delicious gingerbread pancakes and gladiator burgers. Always greeted by one of the friendliest owners in oldtown.

Nice location near shopping and old town. Breakfast was Delish! Lots of choices on the menu and good service. Outdoor sitting available and not too noisy. Worth a return visit!  Healthy portions if you're hungry!!

This place is one of my absolute faves.  They have a well rounded reasonably priced menu.  The food is fantastic and they have a happy hour with some great deals.  I ate there last Sunday with my boyfriend and our bill was $7.91.  We had  two chicken sliders with fries ... A smoking deal if ya ask me.  We were both pleasantly full and walked out paying 12 dollars after tip.  Great food, friendly service and super value - highly recommended!

Ate there a few weeks back for the first time. My buddy had the hash, which was very greasy and over cooked. The waitress recommended breakfast nachos? Not that good. Chips piled with eggs, cheese sauce and then put under the broiler until it was completely dried out. The Atmosphere and bar etc was very nice. But, not the food so much. My first and last time.

A group of friends and I tried this place out last weekend and I was so glad we found it! There is a great happy hour that lasts until 9 pm and it covers entrees, appetizers and drinks. I was able to eat and drink for about $14 and I even took home leftovers. The atmosphere is fun and the waitstaff was friendly and very capable. I plan to go back again, loved it!

I really wanted to like this place- service is good, people are nice- great ambience, but the food has been less than par. I have been 3 times, trying something different each time, and each time disappointed. I have had the stuffed portobello, eggs Benedict and hangover sandwich- all much more bland than one would expect. Too bad, I will stick with D'lish and orange table

Stopped here in Old Town on April 5th after early flight in.  Outside tables were full so we sat inside.  Very nice atmosphere, servers very pleasant and checked in frequently on us.  Husband had the chorizo scramble which came on a large oval plate with potatoes, toast etc.  Looked great and got 5 stars from him.  I had the smoked salmon bennie, also delicious and very comparable to that served at many restaurants in nyc.  I usually stay away from breakfast fried potatoes, but these were excellent crispy on the outside and soft inside AND not greasy.  Coffee was especially good here; maybe they use the Starbucks from next door?

Being locals and a native Phoenician my wife and I were recommended daily dose a few years ago and it has become one of our absolute favorite go to breakfast and brunch restaurants.  We have eaten there dozens of times and have never experienced anything but top quality food and great service! The menu is extensive with lots of gluten-free choices and it comes out fast and hot. Kudos to the owners and management for keeping this eatery current, high-quality and a great place to bring friends and family

Chicken Nachos and Steak Salad is good but the service is TERRIBLE! Not friendly at all...one of the waitresses was SO RUDE I was shocked at how they can have an amazing location with terrible service.

So my friend and I came here Mother's Day.  We first tried U.S. Egg.  We arrived there just after 2:20 but the hostess was rude and told us they were not seating anyone and reminded us they close at 2:30.  I reminded her it was 2:25.  We opted for the Daily Dose and I'm glad we did.  My friend got the Smore Pancakes, which she said were her favorite.  I got the Banana Bread French Toast.  It was so good, plus the service was awesome.  They're staff all seemed so happy we were there unlike U.S. Egg.  If you're considering U.S. Egg, then don't.  Go to Daily Dose.

Tried this after the reviews on Yelp.  Had a bit of a Wait on a Saturday morning, but we expect that.  They told us 10-15 minutes, but it actually was more like 25 minutes.  While we were waiting we saw someone slip the hostess $20 to skip the line - not cool !  Once seated (inside as we took first available) our waitress came over very quickly and took our drink order and then our full order - we got our food very quickly considering how busy it was.  The waitress was very friendly and gave us suggestions on the menu since this was our first time there.  I had the Caprese omelet, which was excellent - my partner had the berry pancakes and said they were good too.  It was a little noisy inside, but the food was excellent and we will be back.

LOVED LOVED LOVED this place.  First, the service was impeccable. Our server was great and others would come by and refill our drinks and check up on us constantly.  The breakfast portions are huge!! The standouts were the breakfast nachos (such a great idea!!) and the pancakes (so fluffy inside but with a light buttery crust on the outside). The hangover sandwich was tasty but overwhelming, it's all protein, which was yummy but left you feeling gross.   The fresh squeezed OJ was great and a huge portion.  They seemed to have great HH specials, but we never made it back.

I had the Southwest wrap and it was amazing! It was served with hashbrowns and fruit and both were excellent. The fruit was ripened to perfection! Next time I i'm going to try the mixed berry protein  pancakes. The menu is not ordinary - effort is put into creating a pleasurable experience in your mouth. Our waitress was very friendly and I love the atmosphere - modern but warm.

Rude service and uninformed manager.. I went in on Saturday and as always, this tiny place was packed.. Line out the door. Not feeling the best, my fiancée and my best friend and I went to the bar to order bloody Mary's while we waited. Apon giving the bar tender (long blonde hair, in 30's) my ID, she studied it skeptically and not thinking it was me(I have brown hair in my pic and I'm now blonde) and after a few awkward moments she asked if I had another ID. I told her no, that when I travel, I only bring one ID so I don't loose any of others I have. I'm 29 years old.. My best friend is 32, and my fiancée is over 40! We don't look young! She didn't ask me to verify any personal info on the ID as they're required to do, but instead stated the obvious that there's no expiration date. News flash: there's no expiration date on AZ state ID's bc they never expire! We tried to inform her of this, and come to find out, she was also a manager that didn't know this information! Her customer service skills were horrible and she didn't even apologize but instead made the drinks and had this attitude like she was doing me this huge favor. No thank you even when I still tipped her 20%. I understand she was trying to do her job but she could have done without all of the snobbiness.  I'm never coming back here again. The food was mediocre and my bagel was stale. The wait just isn't worth it. I recommend Morning Squeeze right up the street on Scottsdale rd.  They're always friendly and the food is ten times better with a lot more healthier options.

We went to Daily Dose on a Saturday June 23 about 10am  when we got there the line seemed endless but the hostess told us it would be a 15 minute wait and she was right on. We sat at the bar which was great service. Food is amazing I had the chorizo eggs Benedict while my husband had the meat omelet with smoked Gouda both were amazingly tasty!,  have a mimosa make it a double and it's a perfect breakfast.   Hostess also took the time to come talk and see how we were doing. Really enjoyed it. We will definitely be back to try lunch or dinner next time.

Based on the previous ratings and recommendations...we gave it a try. We ordered the biscuits and Gravy, seasonal pumpkin pancakes and the jalapeño ham steak. Good on all. Service - Jeanette T. Was very nice and accommodating. However, took way too long in the kitchen!! Be prepared to wait ! We would come back again.

Exceptional service, good atmosphere right in the middle of historic Old town scottsdale with a little patio area/misters. Chicken and waffles were great! Other dishes left of with more to be desired (hollandaise was mediocre).  Good portion size and decent price point.  Good spiked coffee drinks &mimosas (no bottomless).

Just new to town and looking for a place to get a non-traditional breakfast that supports local.  Daily Dose serves a wonderful coffee that is roasted locally at Passport coffee.  A really nice breakfast and I was pleased.
Amazing food great customer service loved it ... so if you visit Scottsdale you gotta swing by Daily Dose

My favorite breakfast place! So many great items to choose from! Had the hangover sandwich which was delicious! Our waiter was pleasantly memorable and helpful! Can't wait to go back to sample more! Highly recommend this quaint place! Pet friendly too! Loved it!

Very disappointed tonight.  Daily dose has been our " go to" place for a while now.  But tonight there is a sign on the Old Town door showing new hours.  No more dinner service.  I don't understand. It was always busy for dinner. They've effectively lost two customers ( my wife and I)  we just don't go out for breakfast or lunch that much.    Too bad. We both loose

I should probably eat here a few more times before giving it a full 5 stars, but 4 stars wouldn't express my enthusiasm enough.  Their sangria is awesome. Their servers have all been amazing. The biscuits and gravy are spectacular, and the hangover sandwich is filling but also amazing. I haven't tried the lunch menu, so I'll be back.  The hostess wasn't the most helpful with trying to get a group of 5 on the patio, but it was probably due to my own uncertainty of where we wanted to sit. Give this place a try for hanging out on the patio or for a good breakfast spot in Old Town.

I've eaten here since they opened and their menu, service and food quality has been good. I eat here at least once every two weeks and they have some of the best best burgers in Phoenix. Also worth checking out are: The milkshakes, the green iced tea, and the Hangover Sandwich.
I waited an hour for biscuits and gravy that tasted like hamburger helper. The waitress discriminated against me because of the way that I am. I'm pissed.

Love the location and decor of this place.  Ventured in based on Google reviews looking for a big breakfast and bloody Marys.  They have a full bar and a very big breakfast menu.  I ordered the blue crab cake omelet which was FABU.  Service was excellent...even though the server managed to pour some ice cold water on my foot!  Just the refresher I needed.
If the rest of the menu is anywhere near as good as the $2 tacos for happy hour this place is amazing!

Location is key to this place.  Sitting on the street side patio offers great people watching opportunities.  An extensive menu provides lots of options for breakfast. The food was good, bacon had some spice! Potatoes were slightly undercooked, but the flavored coating masked it.   The granola was a honey crunch granola which was enjoyable.

We went yesterday am and had to leave because of the horrible service. I had picked up 2 friends from the airport and they were hungry. So I took them to Daily Dose in Old Town. Had been there once before and everything was fine, the food and service was excellent. So, when we arrived we sat outside as my guests wanted to enjoy the weather. We sat for 10 minutes before receiving any attention. My guests were very thirsty, as they had been on a plane for 4 hours. When the waitress finally came, we asked for water, and I ordered a coffee, they ordered drinks. Well, I got the coffee, but nothing else happened for another 5 minutes. When we reminded the waitress she got very snippy and  said that she would find someone else to serve us as she was only one person (she only had our table and another table of 2 to attend to on the patio). Needless to say, she never returned and neither did any other wait staff. After another ten minutes, we decided to leave. I talked with Kiley, the manager, and she apologized. Food is great, service is not. Good luck if you go there - if you want water, bring your own.

I originally had rated Daily Dose with 5 stars but after multiple visits I am discouraged by most of the service.  I was constantly being pushed to order more by the manager/owner and was given a plate of bread that I did not want and charged for it.  If it weren't for the amazing bartenders I don't think I would go back.  Earlier review: Thanks to Absolute Pet Care's Recommendation I had an amazing time at the Daily Dose.  The bartender was fun and friendly, the food is creative and reasonably priced.  I will definitely be back especially since happy hour is from 4-8pm, and they offer free wifi.

This place has GREAT service, awesome food, great happy hour, and nice location.  Go here instead of Starbucks since they offer free Wifi.  I have never had anything here I did not like from the Oatmeal, to the Hummus, signature cocktails, and Sliders!
So excited to be back and enjoy the new menu and beer selection. It was perfect on this rainy night!
Great service Awesome staff but only giving it 4 stars cause happy hour ends a hour before closing

Joined a friend here for a late breakfast, and it was really great!  The place was packed, always a good sign, and I found out why.  We sampled the edamame hummus-AMAZING!  Who knew hummus would work with edamame?  Well, it does here, its got a kick with cilantro and jalepenos.  I had the turkey sausage eggs benedict, really yummy!  First time I've seen turkey sausage on the menu for a benedict option.  The potato wedges were the best I've had in a while.    My friend enjoyed the veggie omlette with a side of cottage cheese, and it was just perfect for her.  I would love to go again and again, it is 30 miles from my home, but next time I'm in Old Town Scottsdale, I will go again for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Big menu with interesting choices.
The hangover sandwich here actually works! I swear whenever I am having a rough Sat. morning I crave that sandwich and if I get it, ahhh I think I am cured. :)

While in a great location, this restaurant tastes more like a glorified IHOP once the food is delivered.  Waffles tasted powdery, pancakes were dry, and the coffee extra burnt. The people working were very nice and the wait wasn't long. If you want a great breakfast head to Arcadia farms instead.

I loved their turkey bene, it was so good I literally kept saying "mmmmm" while eating it! and the bacon bloody Mary,extra spicy, was too good for words! My date had the hangover sandwich, and was impressed!
Best blue crab sandwich! Great atmosphere and reasonable price point. Highly recommend!!

This place is great.  It's becoming a habit.  JenLyn and Matt have their stuff together.  We love Fusion (their other restaurant) so we figured to try it.  Like everything they do, the food is always excellent, staff is personal and quick and the drinks aren't bad either.  My husband like the hangover.  I usually get the french toast or waffles.  We have been there for lunch as well.  You can't get anything bad here.  Trust me.  It's a gotta go to place.

We went to Daily Dose on a Saturday morning at 11:00 am. It was about a 30 minute wait, but they did have free coffee outside and the weather was nice - no complaints there.    We were seated in a large booth and a waitress came immediately to take our drink orders. They serve their water with cucumbers in it, which is unfortunate if you don't like cucumbers.   I order the Shaved Turkey Melt (Thin shaved house roasted turkey topped with caramelized jalapenos & red onion, creamy brie & chipotle mayonnaise on sourdough. 9.99), which sounded very flavorful but was pretty lackluster. I didn't notice caramelized jalapenos, onions or brie - only turkey. The bread was pretty hard so it was difficult to eat.   I would not return.

This places gets a 5 star solely based on the gluten free cinnamon roll cake that I consumed. It was so tasty that even my friend who can eat gluten fell in love. We both thought we died and went to heaven because of this one dish. I also enjoyed my green chili pork omelette minus the cheese but the gluten free cinnamon, which I got as a side was certainly the star dish. The service here was attentive and friendly. I would fly back down to Scottsdale just for the gluten free cinnamon roll cake; no lies. I didn't even mention their adult coffee and morning beverages! The adult beverages really sealed the deal for me. If you live anywhere in the state of Arizona, you should really make a conscious effort to try Daily dose. I can't stop thinking about my orgasmic experience (figuratively speaking) when biting into the gluten free cinnamon roll cake.

Had a great 7 am Sat breakfast here today. No wait, great service. Crab cake omelette was hot & delish.  Crab cakes came atop, not mixed in. Perfect. Comes with toast, home fries (just a tad not hot enough, but that is small potatoes) & choice of fruit, cottage cheese or hash. Thgt the coffee was especially good. (I have low expectations for good coffee at breakfast places). And the homemade fruit jam was a real hit. They should bottle it. Very inviting inside & outside seating.

We eat here regularly, but after a delicious brunch with outstanding service on Sunday, I had to write a review.  I ordered a turkey sausage omelet with a side of the buttermilk blueberry banana pancakes.  BEST pancakes ever!  Our server was Tyler (I believe) and he was so friendly and genuine.

Great place to go and eat breakfast, the quality of the food was amazing. And I'm picky so when I like a place it means something. However we sat at the bar and the server was terrible. I do cook at home a lot with high quality and organic material but when I go out to eat I don't want just the food to be good I want the service to be good too. Will I go back again? NO I WILL NOT GO BACK TO THIS PLACE! Because the server at the bar was terrible and bad service.

My husband and I went with some friends for dinner and we had a great time. We sat outside, so I didn't get a good feel for what the inside was like, but my overall impression was clean and comfortable.  This place has great pricing for EVERYTHING during their happy hour. We got entirely too much food and drink, but we definitely left happy!  The food was really unique and had fun twists on old favorites. It's nice when restaurants put thought into their menus!

I finally got a chance to go back here after almost a couple of years. I just am never at this part of the valley much and the times I have been here, it is never in the morning. Well the first time, was fantastic, I loved the creativity,quality, service, and execution of their food. I wanted to give the place a five star, my second one only in this area so far by the way, but I never give a place 5 stars without at least going there twice. The place is a little expensive and I am pretty cheap but it was well worth it. I believed I had the french toast last time, but even though I don't remember the details, I remember it was some of the most original and quality food I have ever had.   This time I decided to go with  the hangover sandwich which was the first time I had something with Jalapenos here in Arizona that didn't just burn all my taste buds. I could feel it but also able to taste the sweetness of the onions and tangy cheese and saltiness of the bacon. Every where in the valley, they pride themselves of just bringing the heat on like a camp fire, but what really do you get from that except a one dimensional response. People think it is great just because it is ultra spicy beyond belief, but that is the lazy way of cooking which is to toss in some really hot peppers to essentially cover up bad food. The sandwich was great, just wish they had an option for a regular pork instead of turkey sausage which is kind of bland, but maybe they will but I just never asked.  Anyways I also had their DD hash, which is a vegetarian dish, and believe me when I say that is the farthest thing about my eating habits. I gulped it up because it was just so well balanced. The dish came with their potatoes which was okay, but I usually don't like larger chunks of potatoes but most people do so I don't hold that against the restaurant, just not my cup of tea. Their coffee is awesome and you know that they even not only gave me a cup to go, but also made it an ice coffee. For the money it was well worth it. I hope to get a chance to try more of their menu and hopefully sooner than 2 years next time .   A plus and usually I don't really care about this as much as others, but their service is top notch. Helpful but not  bothering you every 2 minutes to get you moving, they don't even bring you the check  until you ask for it, plus it helps to come early in the morning, I hate waiting but I am not an idiot who goes right in rush hour and bitch about it either. I really enjoy it and would recommend it to anyone.

Other than the generous portions DD serves up, I don't see what all the fuss is about.  We stopped in for breakfast mid-morning and we were seated promptly.  The tables at the booths for four (and we were only two) were too narrow and I felt like I was in my husband's face as we ate across from each other.    My husband ordered the roast turkey omelet which came brimming with real turkey, tomatoes, onions and brie.  He said it was quite filling, but didn't make a fuss about the actual flavor. I ordered the meat and cheese omelet minus the chorizo and asked that my omelet be cooked on the soft side. It didn't come out that way, and much to my disappointment, the bacon they use is pepper bacon -- but they don't tell you that on the menu. I had to send it back. To their credit, they were gracious enough to take it off our bill.  What we most enjoyed was the DD Hash, a very tasty blend of butternut squash and onions, perfectly cooked. Absolutely delish! It's a little overkill with the breakfast potatoes that also come with the omelet. Start working on the DD Hash before you dig in to the others because they are so filling and yummy!  Our server was a little aloof, and one of her coworkers stepped up to the plate to better our experience. Had it not been for her assistance, I would surely have rated DD a two.
Eggs Benedict was good but the Hangover sandwich was the clincher. Fantastic!
Good food! Drinks were strong and service was slow. But overall a pretty good experience!

The wait was not bad, they have coffee and water while you wait which is awesome. Our server Holly was amazing. She gave us great recommendations to substitute and upgrade our meal.  Our first time so it was very helpful. The michelada could have used a little more spice but it was still good .  Portions  are a good size.  The cinnamon pancake was really good.

Daily Dose has great food and fantastic service!  Adam went above and beyond to help me get an office order on time for a vendor meeting, and was even able to accommodate dietary restrictions.  Thank you so much for the great meal!

Brunch: banana bread french toast and southwest flannel hash.   I shared with my friend, we both practically inhaled everything. So good!! It was perfect sharing with someone, the sweet & savory combo was perfect.   There was no wait, restaurant is clean and has a nice layout. The Irish coffee and Bloody Mary were so-so, but the food definitely made up for it.   Highly recommend.
I love this place and my, oh my, your sweet potato fries are to die for!

I have been to this location several times. I tend to find a favorite and get it each time. Here, my favorite is the turkey burger on a pretzel bun. Although it is far more food than a single person can have on their own, it does serve great as leftovers.  Everything I have tried in search of my favorite has been excellent. The food alone, deserves 5 stars, but I hesitate to go that far because the service tends to be poor. It's little things like waiting far too long to have your order taken, letting the water get empty, socializing with the bartender instead of serving your customers, poor attitude etc.. These things add up, and as a result my husband won't go there anymore.

Really good omelet.  I mean, really good!   But I wanted to stick a fork in our servers hand 'cause she was giving us the "rush" treatment.   Trying to grab our juice and our plate while we were still eating.  Chill!  The place was half empty.
I loved everything about this place!!  The protein pancakes were fabulous and I was able to get them with gluten free batter. Staff was very personable.  All around great experience.

One of my all time favorite places to eat in Old Town Scottsdale! Their breakfast is amazing, huge selection but I always get a side of bacon because it's cooked perfectly! The vegetable pot pie - YUM! Also they do a great happy hour that goes pretty late as well. Definitely a must try in Old Town! Lines can be long in the mornings (especially on the weekends) so be sure to get their early so you don't have to wait!
Had excellent breakfast and awesome service.  Enjoyed the atmosphere and had pleasant experience.  This place is bookmarked for future trips.

Found this place online.  We were looking for a good place to take the family for breakfast.  All around great food.  The house bacon Bloody Mary was amazing.  Adding this place for a return visit.  Fantastic service.  Kylie was awesome.
Excellent breakfast place!  Trendy and creative food and excellent service. Think sinker doodle pancakes and breakfast nachos!

My family and I came here in December 2017 to celebrate my sister's graduation and the food was amazing!! Despite the long wait, the customer service was excellent! And the yummy food was definitely worth the wait. I will be sure to come back next time I'm in Arizona! Great atmosphere, great food, and amazing drinks!

This place is hands down my favorite breakfast place in AZ! I'm a savory person and my husband is all about sweets so this restaurant allows us to both get what we want with their assorted menu.   My go to order is the Cobb sandwich with a bacon infused bloody Mary and a side of the chorizo mac. My husband always gets a chilled mocha with a pump of caramel and coconut substituted with almond milk (tastes just like a Samoa girl scout cookie) then he picks one of the sweet pancake items. The bacon infused bloody Mary is the best I've ever had. I've debated ordering a virgin one on mornings I'm not feeling a brunch cocktail.  On the slim chance that you have to wait to get in for longer than 15 minutes, they have complimentary coffee and cucumber water out front. When it is busy, the 2 of us normally don't wait longer than 15 minutes for first available seating. The longest wait I've dealt with was 30 minutes black Friday morning with a party of 6.   They also have a bunch of TVs all over the restaurant so we never have to miss a game. The patio one can even be watched while you wait for a table.   My one complaint is that the food service is not fast, but to keep my mind off that I just ask for the chorizo mac side as an appetizer so that we can snack on it while we wait for the main course and I hardly notice the wait.
Will definitely be coming back here before I leave Scottsdale. Mixed Berry Protein Pancakes were awesome, real berries were packed inside.

Daily Dose? Yes please!  1. The menu has something wonderful for every palate and food preference.  2. The staff is always friendly and responsive.  3. Their drink specials are phenomenal.  My favorite is brunch time - you can't go wrong with any omelet or my favorite - the Protein and Iron.  The DD Hash is legit.  Daily Dose is our proverbial go-to whenever we are in the area.

My first visit here I had the hangover sandwich... WOW! I was hooked immediately. The Daily Dose Burger is always prepared to my liking, the Prime Steak Salad is a huge salad and is a delight to my tastebuds! I would stay away from the gravy, it's not what you'd expect from breakfast gravy. The staff is quick, friendly, and on top of their game. I will visit here again and again!
So many great options! Excellent omelettes, different kinds of batters for pancakes, and great coffee. The DD hash is amazing as well.

What can I say? When my girlfriend and I decide we want to go out to eat the very first place that comes to mind is 'the dose'. It's almost annoying because we can't seem to think of anywhere else.  Then we remember the reason we can  think of no better place, consistency. Literally every time we go to dose we leave happy. I also happen to crave their veggie burger on a weekly basis while my girlfriend opts for the kobe. To each his own, and to each, they do a great job.

The Banana Bread French Toast was by far the best thing that came to the table and it warranted 4 stars.  The Power Protein Pancakes sucked, super dry and bland despite being packed with berries - 2 stars The Stuffed Portobello w/ Gouda and Roasted Red Peppers could have been good but it was completely drenched in oil, blech - 2 stars   Overall disappointed with Daily Dose. Will have to keep searching for a great breakfast spot in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area...

Sat at the bar around noon on a Sunday. Seems as if breakfast is there hot items on a Sunday but I went for a burger instead after an early Sunday flight. It was OK. I have been here before and had dinner and it was good.  Next time I go, I'll try the breakfast.
I love the concept- there is a little bit for every taste on the menu.  You can have breakfast or lunch whenever you want!  It is about time someone knows how to make a good biscuts and gravy!!!
This is my favorite spot for breakfast/brunch in Old Town. Amazing service. Delicious food and great prices. I would highly recommend a side of banana bread French toast.
Oh...my.....nacho-ness! I went here, tried their breakfast nachos, and they are just heavenly! I don't even remember how much they cost, all I remember about that day is nachoey goodness. :)
No longer dog friendly! Don't find out the hard way from the rude staff...

My favorite breakfast place in Old Town. Whether you want a heavy comfort hangover breakfast or a light healthy meal, they've got you covered.  The only reason I wouldn't go as regularly as I wanted to was because of the usual long waits during the weekend.  But the food is fantastic. Great portions at good prices and friendly service. I like the eggs Benedict, the French toast and I've heard good things about the chorizo mac n cheese.

Kobe hamburger with pretzel bread. That's all you need to know!   Yeah, I'm a fan! I visited Daily Dose on Whiskey Wednesday. That means $5 whiskeys. After one of those, I just had to eat something! Well, hello Kobe burger! I chose the Daily Dose burger which 8oz is topped with cheddar & jack, peppered bacon, fresh basil, shaved onion, tomato & harissa aioli on a toasted pretzel bun! Whew! The burger was tasty and the pretzel bun was a master stroke. The meat was juicy and cooked to order (medium for me). The toppings added to the flavor of the burger and the pretzel bun was chewy and salted just like a YUMMY pretzel. I was a happy girl!   I hope to visit Daily Dose for breakfast, maybe a lunch! I hope they can wow me like they did before!

I've been here a couple of times and their food is wonderful! Their HH goes on til 8PM and their breakfast items are amazing! We got the hangover sandwhich and it was Great! The waitress even split the meal for us on two separate plates and gave us another cup of fruit. My friend told me to try the pancakes, since they are to die for. Will try that next time!
What a great place to eat breakfast! Nice little outdoor patio and healthy, yummy food!

Have eaten breakfast and dinner at Daily Dose, both are quite good and the patio is a nice place to have a beer after work.  Chill atmosphere and none of the "scene" found at many other Scottsdale restaurants.  I go here often and the service is normally attentive and quick though breakfast may be a little slow if you are in a hurry.  The green chile enchiladas are one of my favorites, would rate them a 5 except the rice they plate up with them is horrible, only bad thing I can say I have had here.  Good chorizo as well as lots of healthier options for breakfast.

This is THE spot for brunch. My mom and I stopped here on a Saturday around 10. There was a wait, but we put ourselves on the list and stood outside on the sidewalk and chatted. The iced tea and coffee table was a nice courtesy for those waiting for a table.  Once we got in, we sat at the bar, which was fun because we got to watch all the action. The decor was beautiful, and it felt so posh to sip my mimosa at the bar.   The food was also great! Mom and I each ordered a variation on eggs benedict (red pepper and black forest ham) and shared. Both were delicious, flavorful, and not too heavy. I finished my plate without feeling weighed down.   All in all, this was such a lovely brunch experience. Thank you, Daily Dose!

Have been here twice now, and both times my tastebuds were tickled with delight. They serve breakfast until 4pm, which is a gift from above, as I love me some breky in the afternoon.
