Don't even bother with the cornmeal battered onion rings. I'm an onion ring aficionado,  and I can tell you this was a real loser. You want your onion ring skin to be crispy, and not corn-mealy and dry and which peels right off.   Anyway this visit was a bust, but I still like this place and I will be coming back with a different strategy in mind
Breakfast nachos and Bloody Mary.. AMAZING! Great service. Highly recommended and will be returning!

I really, really like Daily Dose.  The service is pretty good and the food is darn-near amazing.  Had brunch here with a group of 7-8 recently and it continues to be solid.  Oddly enough a girl friend and I sat at the bar a couple weeks ago and had really slow service.  =/  Usually I choose the bar because your server is always right in front of you if you need something, but that didn't quite work out here.   Happy hour goes every day of the week until 8pm, so that's a bonus!  I've had brunch, lunch, dinner and happy hour here ... They have lots of options for herbivores like myself and carnivores alike.  The cocktail menu is good and their sangria is tasty.  The wait times can be extensive on the weekends for breakfast/brunch, so plan accordingly.
Four words: Creme Brulee Peach Pancakes. Get it. You can get a single pancake for only 3.25 and it's absolutely worth it! The banana caramel french toast was also amazing.
Very positive experience.seated promptly and food was served very quickly. The baked Bree was awesome
Sit outside and people watch and have the hummus-we love this place! A bit pricy, but well worth the service and the quality of the food and drinks.

On my last day in Scottsdale I wanted a good breakfast to fortify me for a long day of travel. The Daily Dose was near the hotel and had good reviews. The pics looked good too.  There was a bit of a wait, but no biggie. It was sunny, but a very strong cold wind was blowing. We ended up on the patio, but there was a heater, so it wasn't bad, but we did get a lot of wind. At one point, the wind blew off the table my tortilla for my dish.   I love green chilie pork and they had this great dish on the menu that included white beans, pork, with eggs and avocado. Sounded delish. It was mostly good. The flavors were there but sadly, the beans were not all the way cooked, they were way too firm still, and I couldn't eat them. But the chilie sauce and the eggs and the pork, in a tortilla were good. It was disappointing though, as the beans were a major component of the dish.  I also ordered one side pancake for my friend and I to share. It was almost like a crepe, it was that thin. It also was really rubbery. You couldn't cut through it with the fork. Very strange.  Service was outstanding though. When my tortilla flew off the table from the wind, she gladly got me another one. Our server was friendly and working hard.   Overall it was good, and I'd give them another chance, but someone should test the beans before they decide to serve them.

We absolutely love coming here for breakfast whenever we're in town!  We always walk here & it doesn't matter if there's a wait to get in, it's worth it to us!  Today my husband had the Eggs Benedict & I had the Pig in a Bagel & the waitress was super accompanying with my changing the bacon to ham, adding cream cheese to the sandwich & sliced tomato on the side instead of potatoes !  The bloody Mary's are always yummy when we don't opt for fresh squeezed oj with vodka !!
Cute joint with nice decor and really good breakfast.  Everyone at our table ordered something different we all loved it!
Visiting Scottsdale for a wedding and came here for breakfast. Really great food made with fresh ingredients. Friendly staff. Delicious!

Had a burger here on my latest trip to Scottsdale! Service was fine but a bit slow as I sat at the bar, and the lone BT was busy! Still she poured me a beer and a water, so I was fine with the wait! The bar is open at 7 am along with the restaurant which is nice for shift workers like myself! A decent selection of beers, mamosas and other crafty cocktails! You can get a full bottle of champagne and choice of juice for $20. I ordered the Gladiator Burger which comes with grilled onions and jalapeños, I ordered it with onion rings! The food came out relatively quickly and was served hot and fresh, the onion rings were hot and fresh as well, but I wasn't impressed with the corn meal batter which was gritty and rather bland and just too heavy! The onions inside however were sweet and delicious! My Burger was slightly over cooked but it was still juicy and tender, although it could use a bit more seasoning! I ordered it on Rye Bread which is my go to way to eat burgers, and the bread was fresh and delicious! Overall the meal was solid, and I like that I could order from the lunch menu and have a beer at 7am! I would definitely come again, as I left full and happy!

Good food, great patio and friendly service; these are three Daily Dose highlights. After walking by the Dose several times in the last year, I've finally had a chance to visit a handful of times and I'm adding this to my list of weekend afternoon or happy hour stops.   I first visited for happy hour. I was pleased to learn that domestic beers were just $2 and they served them in ice cold glasses. Now for those who know me, they know that I don't typically drink beer from a glass. Not sure why, but there's just something about drinking out of a bottle. But, in the case of the Daily Dose, I went with the glass this time because it was so cold it chilled the beer to perfection. After reading so many reviews about the Daily Dose burger, I had to give it a try. Not bad burger lovers. The pretzel bun added to the taste and the burger was solid. The fries were OK. I had the combo but preferred the regular fries to the sweet potato ones. One thing that surprised our group was that the restaurant does last call at 9 on the weekdays, so we noted that this isn't your choice for making it a late night.   The second time I visited, my friend and I split the citrus avocado salad with cilantro lime dressing and the shaved turkey melt with brie. I really liked the unique kick to the salad due to the combo of fruit and avocado. It was a refreshing bed of greens. The turkey melt was a combination of brie, jalapenos and chipotle mayo on sourdough bread. It's a great sandwich if you're in the mood to consume some cheesy calories.   Both times, I've enjoyed the food and will definitely remember the Daily Dose when my tummy starts growling again.

Very busy on a Saturday morning but not too long a wait. This establishment really caters to those who like to drink alcohol at breakfast. The food was okay, pretty standard breakfast food for Scottsdale. The coffee was okay. The service was very good.  I'll probably try somewhere else next time.

Fast, friendly service. I couldn't choose between a few menu items so our server let me know I could substitute items making it my perfect meal and I got everything I wanted. Food was amazing! New breakfast spot for sure

We had a bit of a wait (25 min) on a Friday morning but it was definitely worth it! Great m, attentive yet not overbearing service (thanks, Keegan!) and the food was awesome (I had the chorizo omelet, while my husband had the flannel hash Benedict)! Great vibe here, we'll definitely be back!
Had a fantastic breakfast here.  Thanks to Jeanine for the great rundown of the menu!  Will be back for sure!!!

Whenever I'm in the Phoenix area I make it a point to come to Daily Dose.  The Green Chili Chicken Enchiladas are always great and the cilantro lime dressing is light and flavorful on salads.  Check it out, you won't be disappointed!

I went here for breakfast and was a little wary because I don't like eggs and most breakfast menus are full of nothing but eggs.  One thing on the breakfast menu really stuck out to me - banana bread french toast.  I may not like eggs but I LOVE banana bread.  Add some caramelized bananas on top and some vanilla sauce and caramel sauce AND nuts?  Now that just sounds like heaven.  And it was.  There were 2 full slices (I ate one for breakfast and took the other home for lunch).  I opted for the side of fresh fruit (I can't remember what the other choices were) and this was good also.  Their ice water has cucumber slices in it - different and refreshing!  I would definitely go back.

Went here for a family brunch for my birthday. It's been a year or so since my last visit so we decided on this location. There was 5 of us and we had about a 30 minute wait to sit on the patio which was fine with us. We had a great server as she took our orders. I ordered the Eggs Benedict as that is my usual go to item at brunch...well both eggs were overcooked so it wasn't that good. We all kind of shared or had bites from the other dishes and they were all very good. My mom had the cinnamon roll pancakes, my brother had the berry protein pancakes and my brother's girlfriend and my dad got the turkey sausage omelet. Since the portions were quite big we all got to share it. Everyone else's food was much better than mine. I don't think I'll get the Eggs Benedict again from here as they were really overcooked. Again, service was very good which was great!

Stopped by this hidden gem in Scottsdale during a girls weekend and loved it! The food was flavorful, the fresh brewed coffee was delicious and our server was friendly and attentive. Definitely worth a visit!

Came here yesterday for a late dinner and drink and was impressed. I had thought this was only breakfast and my dinner was delicious. They have a great happy hour and list of beers to choose. I would come back again and want to try it for breakfast as well. Only downside was they close at 9 and felt a little rushed to leave starting around 8pm. As a former server, I understand but others might not.

The staff is freaking awesome at Daily Dose! They seated me immediately and, because the weather was a bit chilly, set up the heaters. My server was amiable, attentive and helpful with suggestions and knowledgeable about the area.   I had the Poblano Eggs Benny and a bacon-bloody Mary. I'll be honest, the food was...okay...lacking robust and memorable flavors. Not the best I've had; not the worst. BUT THE SERVICE was impeccable, and had I never had an eggs benny I may not have known better and considered myself fortunate.

Lots of spring ball fans here, I see SF gear everywhere!  Ended up getting the Southwest Flannel Hash ($10):  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HCCg-rVnHQ2FI6lHs_LvUQ?select=1x1RZ-jpHgil1l7aoTQ4zw  I must say, this hash was very tasty!  The corned beef was cook and seasoned nicely, and the portion was generous.  Ancho Chili Reuben (I think?):  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HCCg-rVnHQ2FI6lHs_LvUQ?select=iruecxnja3wL0c6uAKeVWQ  Only got to take a small bite, but it was good.    Irrelevant complaint:  Didn't like the whole cucumber slice in the water deal, it was NASTY!  But that's minor and won't stop me from coming back.
Stopped in today for breakfast for the 1st time.  Service and food was great! I ordered the 2 egg shooter which came with pancakes,  your choice of meat and fruit.  Very affordable, I will return.

I came here on my lunch break and met up with a good friend. It was busy but we got a table right away. Everyone was so nice and cheery. I had the best chorizo mac and cheese on the planet! It was so filling and I had enough left over for another meal! My friend got some special grilled cheese but said my mac and cheese topped it! I can't wait to go back!

This review is for my recent experience. I've been to the restaurant many times so obviously the food is good.   The service however today was terrible. We walked up at 8:50 on Sunday morning and saw there was an available table fit for two on the patio. I requested the table and was told we could sit there. However, rather than seating us there at the perfectly clean and ready table we were told their server needed to catch up and it would take less than 10 minutes to get seated so we were put on the list, first ones up. No problem. 10 minutes go by and more and more people are walking in and getting their names put down. One family even sat at the specific table without putting their name down. I went to the front and asked if we were still waiting for that table. He explained the table was ours and they would ask the family to wait. That happens, but then another 10 minutes goes by (they seat 2 9tops that came in after us) and we are still standing outside staring at our table. I asked the host why and he said that the patio server was behind and they would rather us not wait at the table not being served. WTF. Obviously I would rather sit at a table with some water than stand on the other side of the fence staring at it. Apparently it would have been above his or anyone else's job to bring us two glasses of water and let us sit comfortably. On top of it I said, you do realize you sat 18 people whose food orders will now go in ahead of ours. He said I know, and I'm sorry. Ooookaayyy.   When a server is down your management needs to step in. We left because the whole situation was super rude and after a certain point it seems that our satisfaction and business didn't matter at all.   This is Arizona, your patio server should be your most capable. And you should probably have more than one.

it was early...saturday. the wife and i cruised up to Daily Dose for a breakfast morning out. the place was relatively slow when we arrived. which is why i was a bit miffed at how below-average the service was.  like the good patrons we are, we waited to be seated. once seated, we waited....and waited...for menus. then waited...and waited for any service. then waited....and waited...for coffee (which still is some of the best restaurant coffee i've ever had). then waited....and waited....and waited....and waited....for our food. then waited...and waited...and waited....for our water and coffee to be refilled. so i got up and tried to find it myself.   the food is good. the breakfast potatoes are delicious. i ordered the mixed berry pancakes and they were tasty as well. our server was friendly but there was just a lack of it. i guess after 2 tries, we'll stick to our other breakfast hangouts.

Went to Scottsdale for brunch, and our favorite place in town is Daily Dose.  Would have given it 5 stars, but we had to wait about 20 minutes for a table, and there waiting area inside is a bit cramped.  However, there are seats outside and they provide complementary drinks, but it was chilly outside and the wife and I decided to stay inside.  The wait and amount of people that bear waiting is a testament to how great the food is here.  Our absolute favorite is the breakfast nachos!  The chips are crispy and the toppings are an awesome combination of chorizo, cheese, sausage and some other things I can't name but tastes awesome!  It also comes with sausage gravy which is great as well.  I love this place and recommend it to anyone looking for a good breakfast joint, if you don't mind waiting.

Sunday Funday started out fabulously thanks to this amazing restaurant!  We started with an appetizer of chicken nachos... and MY GOD. The "appetizer" was a plate big enough to feed three hungry females and STILL have leftovers.   I'm super picky when I order anything and all of my orders end up being a complicated mess (Can you substitute this? Can I have this on the side? I need dipping sauce.) Our waitress - I'm so bummed I can't remember her name - was the sweetest lady. She was so patient with me and brought out the food exactly how I wanted to see it. Everything was incredibly delicious, too.  Then, to top it all off, apparently they were closing early for their company holiday party. We started noticing people disappearing from the restaurant and we asked the manager if they were closing, to which he replied, "yes, we closed at 2pm." It was 3:30 when we looked at the clock and I couldn't believe it! They let us sit and enjoy our meal without making us feel rushed or even mentioning their early closing time. That was stellar customer service and I would give them 10 stars for that if I could.  Try this place - you will LOVE it.
Great breakfast! Love the lox omelet and the berry protein pancakes.

Nothing special. The food was ok. I ordered huevos rancheros but they came out cold. They did have coffee for all the people waiting which was nice. Definitely not going to go back. Not the best place, not the worst. It definitely not worth waiting 30+ minutes for. 2 1/2 stars

Joined a friend for lunch.  Underwhelmed by the choices, selected veggie burger, it was not tasty.  Beer selection is blah.  I chose a microbrew, from the menu, but they'd just discontinued it.  So, went with the boring national brand I can get anywhere.  Friendly staff, but that isn't good enough for a return visit.

Upon stumbling up and down S-dale road during our day rage in the sun, we popped into here craving some epic gourmet burgers. Delicious burgers we got, service was a little slow and off, and the beer selection was sadly smaller that we expected. Their menu was pretty wide, but nothing to ooo and ah over.

This is a solid breakfast place with a ton of great choices. The turkey sausage omelet was tasty, but I could take or leave the potatoes. It is a great casual place to take a group. The patio is dog friendly and the restaurant looks very kid friendly. I came here with a group of four and everyone left satisfied.

Great food. I love their food. But I need to make this very clear for fellow dog lovers. Though this restaurant can be listed as "dog-friendly" on some sites, they are more "dog-tolerant" and that's being generous. We brought out puppy husky to have lunch on the patio since they were listed as a dog-friendly restaurant. We were informed as we were sitting down after already placing our order that out dog had to sit outside the fence next to the table. This was a nightmare. Since our dog was a puppy at the time he whined and whined and whined because he wanted to sit at our feet. He constantly tried to climb back over to sit at our feet and the manager continually walked by the table to check under and make sure our husky was not lying at our feet. It made me and my friends tired and anxious to not only listen to the puppies whining and having to push him back outside the gates but to see the little male manager come out again and again to check under our table. We ended up scarfing whatever food we had so we could get out. The waiter was very sweet about the situation but I ended up irritated because we couldn't have the slightest bit of leeway and have the dog lay down under the table quietly instead of less than one foot away behind the fence. But other than that, great food and great service :P

Hit or miss, but usually worth the wait!  Hit: crab cake benedict (regular style is better than the Daily Dose style with the gravy, imho)  Miss: hangover sandwich (cute name, but actually unappetizing). sangria-margarita slushie looks/sounds yummy, but actually was so gross I couldn't finish it #rare  If they tweaked the menu a lil bit, this place could be A+

We came here twice and the visits were three weeks apart. We got the same server and she remembered us!  The host was respectful and nice and our server was a very cool lady that helped us pick out some items both times, because we were pretty unfamiliar.  Good breakfast and lunch joint. First time we came, I had the chorizo eggs benedict. The hash was squash or something, I don't recall. I had a side of sweet potato fries. I didn't even finish the plate. It was a lot of food and very presentable.  A lot of people always compare breakfast joints to Dennys, saying they could have gotten the same taste. I mostly agree... with breakfast, it's usually a similar process but you will never get food as pretty as this at a Dennys. The squash hash is very good but very, very sweet.  Second time I was really hungry, so I got the Daily Dose burger. I never order burgers because fast food turned me off of them but this was good. It was so big I had to eat the toppings and meat in sections!  We never waited. We usually came around 2ish and were seated right away. This would be five stars with all the great service and accommodations but the food didn't blow me away. It was good but standard, for the most part.

This one has been in my bookmark list and I was so glad to finally cross it off The hostess was very nice and although it was pretty packed she gave us the option to wait for a table or sit at the bar...  We were hungry and I like sitting at bars, just because it is always a fun experience So we sat at the bar The girl with the blonde hair (she was the only blonde) was super fun and talkative She really made out daily dose experience great. She  was soooooo friendly... I really liked her and she didn't have to try hard to please us. She took out orders and made sure our drinks were full...  The manager was also very nice and also made us feel very welcomed  As for my meal I chose the flannel corned beef hash meal and it was surprisingly good It was a twist on the traditional corned beef hash and I liked it My over medium eggs were yummy I usually don't eat toast when I order but I guess I was hungry and chowed it down  All in all, daily dose is a great breakfast place and I hope that everyone has a great experience here  Get a mimosa

Delicious and creative  Their menu is vast with so many unique breakfast and lunch iteams that you don't find most places.  Food Breakfast Nachos-STUPID, Nachos topped with eggs, scallions, tomatoes, sausage, sour cream and cheese. All served with a side of CRACK sausage gravy.   Mimosa-Nice and strong with a splash of OJ just the way I like it.  I have also had their Breakfast Sandwhich and that is the best breakfast sandwhich I have ever had.   Great place to go with good customer service and a good time.  Expect a wait on weekends..

Well this is truly a hidden gem in Old Town Scottsdale. The wife and I visited this establishment last Sunday after church. There is usually a long wait here...but we arrived about 10 am and there was no wait. We were seated very quickly and the service was very good...there was a little wait for our food but no complaints about that though. I had 2 great buttermilk pancakes, turkey sausage, eggs, potatoes, and hash...the price....only 9 bucks plus tax...a really great deal. So if your ever in Old Town Scottsdale and need a great breakfast to get your day started...visit this establishment. Eat, Drink, and Be Merry my Friends!!!!!

mmmm straight of the plane and off to daily dose before a baseball game. Husband had the breakfast nachos which were super tasty. I had a turkey sausage eggs benedict. I love any time I get to enjoy turkey sausage so I was already happy seeing this on the menu but lucky me, it also tasted good. Definitely want to go back to try some of the really unhealthy delicious things friends recommended (banana bread french toast).  They don't take reservations for brunch but it was about a 20 minute wait even though there were TONS of people waiting so not bad at all.

Let me start by saying I totally disagree with another reviewer who said this place looks like a pub/sports bar when you first walk in.  It doesn't, in my opinion.  You want the feeling like you are walking into a sports bar?  Go to Zipps down on Camelback and Miller.  THAT's a sports bar, and definitely not a pub.  So, me and my Complimentary Force, aka SO, aka, Mrs., went here for the first time this past Sunday.  We live within walking distance and always said we would try it, as we have with many of the other breakfast joints in Old Town.   Service - 5 stars.  The entire staff was friendly, smiling and seemed genuine.  Our server, Miguel, was super nice, informative and if he didn't know the answer to a question, like, "hey, who makes your bread", he would go find out.  Food - Okay, I would like to go higher, but this is based on my personal food preferences.  I'm giving the food 4 stars because as FRESH, WELL PREPARED and THOUGHTFUL everything was, the caramelized onions were too sweet for me.  I had the chorizo omelette and the presentation and flavor of the chorizo was great.  The potatoes were yummy and the marble rye bread was really tasty, made by a local Phoenix bakery that sells to restaurants only (thanks for the info, Miguel!)  The rosemary crème fraîche that was included was distinctively wonderful.  My included side was the flannel hash, which tasted like it used both russet and sweet potatoes.  Again, very good, just too sweet.  My lady love had the southwest flannel hash, and like the chorizo omelette, the caramelized onions were too sweet but everything else about it, meat, potatoes, etc... were very good.    Neither of us are huge into sweet-tasting food (we're sweet already!) so that's where the lack of 5 stars comes from.  Coffee - great!  Both the leaded and unleaded (that's caffeinated and decaf for anyone not savvy to the lingo).  I would definitely recommend Daily Dose to anyone and will also eat here again.  Bon appetit!

My husband first took me to this restaurant over two years ago.  It is a hip little place that has both inside and outside seating.  We have only been there for breakfast and lunch, but that's okay because the food is great!  The menu is diverse without being overwhelming.  Sometimes you try a place that mixes flavors that just shouldn't be together.  At first, I thought this might be the case at DD, but not so.  I suggest you set your volume on adventure and jump in.  Try the place a few time, with different dishes each time.    I have tried most of their omelets, except for the tempeh and grains, greens and beans, and the crabby (shellfish allergy).  My favorite is the Lox omelet.  I like it with the Lox inside the omelet with the cream cheese mixed with the eggs.  I also like a side of hollandaise sauce to pour over top. Mmmmm... Always go for the DD hash on the side of anything you order. Don't ask, just do it.  There are three breakfast bowls and I only go with two.  Hint: I am not a big fan of tempeh and baby kale. Pancakes!!  My only other favorite place for pancakes is First Watch's and their carrot cake pancakes.  The cinnamon roll pancakes at DD are enough to send me into a food coma just from the shear smell.  Incredible! French Toast?  Yes, please!  Their banana bread french toast are so good.  We get a plate and share between 4 people.  They are incredibly delicious; like a Saturday treat for a week well done. The waffles are amazing.  The peanut butter and jelly sound interesting?  They are actually really yummy! There are a few dishes worth mentioning on their specialty item section. Take a chance and try the Southwest wrap, the Hangover sandwich or the Southwest Flannel Hash.  You might find a favorite.  Daily Dose has become a wonderful addition to a restaurant repertoire.  This is now a place that we regularly meet friends on an early Saturday morning, to talk, eat, and relax a nice chill setting.  We love this place and that won't change anytime soon.

My mom and I went here for brunch the other day and loved it! I ordered the caprese omelette and my mom ordered the southwest wrap, both delicious. But what we really appreciated was their attention to detail, they add a slice of cucumber to the water and offer such a great selection of sides! Since I was on the clock, I couldn't order a mimosa, but I took my friend during the weekend so I could try one of their specialty mimosas, yum!

Came here after unsuccessful attempts to find a good place that would serve breakfast at 2 pm on a Monday haha. Glad we stopped in because it was a good experience! The ambiance feels kinda typical for old town haha. It was cool sitting near the nice bar they have!  They had their happy hour going on so my sister and I ordered mimosa cocktails. My sister got a strawberry one and I got a ginger one. They looked so cute, but they were 90% champagne. Good if you're looking for a strong drink, but we were not haha. I was happy to see vegetarian friendly stuff marked on the menu! I got the tempeh breakfast burrito. My sister got the strawberry ginger granola. I was worried I wouldn't like my burrito due to past bad tempeh experiences, but it was quite delicious! I can't eat eggs anymore but miss enjoying delicious breakfast burritos, this hit the spot. I also got potatoes as my side, it was enough for me to share and tasted great when I added them to my burrito! My sister liked her granola too. And prices are reasonable! And servers are nice! I'd for sure come back if I were in the area and craving a breakfast burrito.

Found this place walking around old town Scottsdale. The food was fast and delicious I had the daily doze burger and is a must to have if you come go there. The waitress that helped us "Silvia" was a sweetheart, checked on us constantly and always had a smile. The next time I'm back in Scottsdale I'll make sure to eat there again.

I usually only like salty breakfast-but this place has the most amazing French Toast, Pancakes and Waffles...MMmmmm.    For that i want nothing more than to give it 5 stars but like i mentioned, i like salty breakfasts.  They do have some good items but as an overall, the items lack a bit of flavor and have been cold when i have eaten there.   -I have had some basic poached eggs w bacon and potatoes, the                          hangover sandwich, and a wrap-as well as bites from whatever my breakfast partner has had.  Hopefully you have better experiences on your meals than i have.  But like i said, their sweet breakfasts are WONDERFUL. At the very least go in and try them for those. Happy Eating!

Don't order take out. You'll get your food faster if you order in. I've been waiting 30 minutes for the chicken tenders I ordered a half hour ago. My refund is taking even longer, and apparently, they burned my food twice.   It's called lunch hour, not ruin my lunch waiting all day on twice burner chicken tenders. FYI - I orders it b/c I figured it's the easiest and fastest thing to make.

Before we start, I had high expectations for this place.  So the word on the street was this place was kickin' it.  Yeah, it was a tad bit busy during my visit and they had their happy hour specials chalked on the wall right when you walk in.  Great HH 4pm to 8pm --- Yah!  I came right on time 7:50pm hehe.  I ordered the Daily Dose Burger -- Bacon and grilled onions --- ohhh.  Well, I enjoyed my burger, but it didn't really kick or pow me palate in anyway.  Needless to say it was decent.  Service, my delight was probably from the hostess, cute gal with a broken arm awww.  Had a fun conversation about the restaurant and made fun of some of the patrons.  I had this weird desire to sign her cast, but didn't want to ask haha!  As for the ambience, it was what I expected - petite with a cute relax atmosphere.  Crowded for sure, but I always enjoy low lite bars with X-mas lights! - Enjoy

I initially visited Daily Dose about a year ago after a night out.  I was only able to stomach some coffee and a few bites of breakfast nachos that morning, so I wanted to come back for a real (sober) meal.  Alas, they made a better impression on my first visit, headache and all.  My recent visit was on a Sunday, around 11:30am, and surprisingly there wasn't a line.  We had a 5 min wait though, so we helped ourselves to water & coffee from the pitchers outside.  When we were called to our table I was a little disappointed - the table was tiny and squeezed between the door to the front patio and a server's station - but I let it go.  My son knew he wanted a cheeseburger and I finally decided on the Ancho-chile corned beef sandwich with sweet potato fries.  Yes, this was going to be a cheat day!  Our waitress seemed.... off, and lacking personality.  She didn't take our menus after we'd ordered and there was no where to put them on the tiny table, so they ended up propped up against the window.  Same thing with our paper cups we'd brought in from outside - they sat next to the menus the whole meal.  The wait for our meals was a little long in my opinion - about 35 minutes.  During that time, our waitress was completely MIA and our drinks sat almost empty.  Thankfully, the guy who finally brought out our food was nice enough to refill them.    So, I thought corned beef rubbed with ancho chili spice and topped with sauerkraut on rye was going to be a bomb of savory, tangy, spicy flavor!  But.... not, not at all.  What in the hell do you do to sauerkraut to make it BLAND?  How do you make these yummy ingredients just completely flat??  Frankly, I was PISSED I wasted so many calories on this sandwich.  I ate half because I was really hungry but didn't even bother to take the other half home.  On a more positive note, the sweet potato fries were excellent.  Feeling unfulfilled, I decided to try my son's cheeseburger.  Even though it was from the kid's menu, the burger was ENORMOUS and they sure didn't skimp on his fries either.  Sadly, the burger was also really under-seasoned and I honestly wondered if they'd seasoned it at all.  The pretzel-bread bun was the most flavorful part of the burger - it was yum!  About 15 minutes after our food came out, the waitress finally came by.  I asked her for a box (for my son's burger) and the check, which she brought to us at the speed of light.  I was very surprised to see I'd been charged $2.50 for a glass and a half of lukewarm, weak iced tea.  If I'd known that, I would've ordered a Tecate light for the same price.  Anyway, I got the distinct impression she wanted us to leave so her table could be re-seated with people who would drink and rack up a bigger bill.  Her loss, as I usually tip very generously when I'm out with my son.   Overall, I was just totally bummed with Daily Dose's food, service, and value - and bummed my 100th Yelp review only deserves 2-stars.

I've only been here for breakfast once but will definitely be returning soon! Yum! I had the strawberry creme brûlée waffle and my friend got the crab cake eggs benedict. Both plates were amazing! My waffle tasted like dessert and I couldn't finish it. I tasted my friend's crab cake eggs benedict and it was heavenly. I will order that next time!!   As far as drinks, I had a peach bellini and my friend tried one of the bloody marys. She was excited because they had five or six different kinds of bloody marys to choose from. Personally it's not my thing, but she said it tasted great. The bellini was sweet but I would recommend getting a double.   Our server was nice and attentive but not bothersome. We arrived relatively early (around 915) so there wasn't any wait to sit down, but by the time we left, the entrance was full of people waiting for tables. The atmosphere of the restaurant was pleasant and hip without being too aggressive. Unlike other places in Old Town, the music wasn't blasting and I didn't feel like I was at a club for breakfast. I enjoyed the food and will come back soon!

This place is AMAAAAAAZE! The potatoes are delicioso; the fruit is fresh and sweet; and the protein pancakes were LIFE in pancake form! . That's all I've had from here, but my picky friend got the loaded nacho joints (I can't remember what they call them here) and he said they were BOMB. He also said the guac was really good after saying he doesn't like guac lol . I second the guac, DEELISH! Anyway, chill place for brunch, amazing food, and basic...? customer service (nothing stands out).

Ate at Daily Dose today after church and we made it just before the long wait. Great atmosphere and very attentive staff, I had the prime rib & cremini mushroom omelet yum. The pancakes looked inviting with the various toppings but I couldn't bring myself to get just pancakes and fruit for was an omelet or regular breakfast would cost. I would love to try their happy hours because $4 margaritas and $2 tacos sounds like the makings of a great Monday nite.

Breakfast nachos?!?!?!??!?!?!!!!  They were good. Totally completely not healthy, but so tasty. I'm not a biscuits and gravy kind of girl, but the sausage gravy is insanely good. I will admit, this dish is really rich - It could have used maybe a little more spice?  It would be a good sharing appetizer if you brunch here with a group.  As a solo breakfast, I'm glad I got to experience it, but I dunno if I can handle that again!  Overall, really like this place. And so many options for breakfast!!! The only drawback here is the parking.

A nice spot in Old Town Scottsdale. I came on a Saturday for brunch with my husband and sister-in-law. There was a long wait - we were quoted 25 minutes but it ended up taking closer to 40. But we did get a table outside.  It's road-side, but there is a nice area to wait and they offer free coffee and water. It's not a busy walking street so there are a few chairs and plenty of space to stand. Fortunately the weather was good.  We were finally seated on the patio, which fit a lot of people in a small space. Clean, and a nice atmosphere. It wasn't loud or overcrowded despite the limited space.  The service was, unfortunately, very spotty. The server mentioned it was her third day on the job - I don't know if it was her first time waitressing but after the long wait we didn't have much patience. She brought a coffee with no cream or sweeteners, then came by with some 2% I'd requested for my tea, but no tea. Then she disappeared for a long time. Eventually the host came to apologize again for the initial wait and we told him what we were still waiting for. He came back with the tea, a fresh coffee, and cream. The server didn't seem to notice that she hadn't been the one to bring them.   Anyway, I had a god good crab cake eggs Benedict with potatoes and fruit. The eggs were perfectly poached and the hollandaise was good, not too rich. My dining companions seemed happy enough with their meals too, though by that point we probably would've eaten just about anything.  Seems like a decent restaurant but we had a frustrating experience.

Tried this place on a Friday afternoon for lunch. I waited a couple of minutes to be seated which was reasonable since the restaurant was fairly busy. The staff was friendly and appropriately attentive. I ordered the southwest chop salad with grilled chicken. The order was delivered quickly and met my expectations. The salad was fresh and crisp and not overly drenched in dressing. This was a long social lunch and I appreciated that the staff didn't pressure or rush us out of our seats after we finished eating. I'll definitely be back again.

You cannot go wrong trusting Daily Dose for your brunch needs. It is an excellent choice any morning and is in a prime location in Old Town. They do not take reservations so try to get there early to get your name on the waiting list (and yes, there is usually a wait but it's worth it). While you're waiting, enjoy the complimentary coffee or infused water which is a really nice touch.   Depending on how hungry you are, try out my go to ordering technique - some sort of healthy egg white entree with a pancake on the side (for your guilty side). I got the egg white omelette with a side of fresh fruit, which was delicious, and followed that up with a side order of the cinnamon roll pancake. IT WAS INSANE. This is a warning, if you like cinnamon rolls, you will love this pancake. And you will feel horrible and super guilty later, but it's so worth it. Plus, eating something healthy before kind of offsets the damage, right? And it's actually a cheaper option than getting one of the more expensive entrees.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is fantastic and lively, the servers are phenomenal, and I like that they often have themed menu items if their is a holiday coming up.

Walked up to this bustling spot and thought shoot, we will have to wait forever. Pleasant surprise to be seated within 10 minutes at the bar (which we prefer anyway).   The service was great! The staff was sweet and helpful. They were cranking out French press coffee and it was so fun to watch. Seems to be popular there.   I ordered the turkey Sausage and Polenta bowl. It was out of this world. I'm  a sucker for white beans and the eggs, Turkey Sausage and fried Polenta are served on a bed of the white beans. Absolutely delish dish.   Hubs had the Flannel Hash and he thoroughly enjoyed it especially since he loves corned beef.   I'd gladly go back for more. There was so much on the menu I'd like to try. Quite the selection of omelets, Benedicts and pancakes.   Being that it's in Old Town Scottsdale, you'll have lots to see before or after brunch too.   Check it out and let me know what you get!
Perfect location for breakfast before SF Giants spring training game. Also, Perfect location for drinks and snacks after the game. Enjoyed 3 meals in two days and will recommend to all my friends.
Great portions for the price! Had the Hangover Sandwich & my boyfriend had Cinnamon Roll Cakes. All of it was absolutely wonderful & the service was great as well! We will be back!
One of the best places for Breakfast!  My wife and I went here at least once a week!  Offers health options too!

My husband, and I heard Great things from the locals about daily dose so we decided to check it out.  We were happy that we did.  The wait was 30 minutes or so on a Saturday which is pretty typical from what we hear. They had chairs outside the restaurant, and also provided free coffee while we waited. Once inside we were waited in by Tonia who is super sweet, and attentive to our needs. The food was delicious, and there were a number of healthy options to pick from which is sometimes a challenge. All in all we were so happy to of had such a great experience.  Much love from chicago!

Daily Dose is hands down my favorite restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale. I began going there when it first opened for brunch and was highly impressed by the multiple options they have available for the ways in which you can order Eggs Benedict. You can get them with roasted red pepper, asparagus, chorizo or my personal favorite...thinly sliced prime rib. In addition, they give you the option to order them "DD style" in which they replace the  english muffin and hollandaise sauce with a biscuit and gravy.   After enjoying their brunch on multiple occasions, I became curious about their happy hour. Not only do they have the most convenient happy hour schedule (4-8pm!) but their menu options are amazing as well. Unlike their morning hours during which there tends to be quite a wait time for a table, there is always availability during dinner time and the atmosphere is very comfortable. I don't think I have ever had anything from Daily Dose that was not to like.  Their sangria is delicious also :)   Some of my  favorite menu items:   Butternut Squash Ravioli   Prime Rib Eggs Benedict   Tacos (any)  Veggie Dip  Chicken Nachos (their salsa is great)   Panko Crusted Calamari  Cilantro, Jalapeno & Edamame Hummus  Chocolate Cake MMMmmm!

Best breakfast in Old Town. Great local spot with awesome food and drinks. Mimosas have a great pour and I personally love the Turkey Sausage Egg Benedict. If you want a VERY indulgent treat try the Breakfast Nachos**Splitting Recommended**All in all great spot, lunch and dinner awesome too but I mostly go for Breakfast.
Very pleased with the menu, and more so with the taste.  It is not easy making healthier choices flavorful, but they pull it off. Also, good prices.

Food was delicious, nicely portioned, good prices good vibes. Definitely a must!!   I had eggs Benedict with the turkey sausage it was 10/10   I also got banana bread French toast, very tasty! Must try.

Came here on a Saturday morning for breakfast. Love the misters on the awning, it made dining outside more comfortable. We were happy they opened early on Saturday since a lot of brunch restaurants in the area don't open til 11am. The restaurant was very busy but we managed to snag a table with no wait. The service was quick and attentive, when we were worried there was a mix-up in our coffees our waitress offered to make us new ones. They have lots of fun iced coffee drinks with syrups which we tried. I had the southwest flannel hash with two poached eggs which was delicious and a perfect portion. It was so hard to pick anything because the menu was so big and everything sounded great.

For a restaurant whose name sounds like a Coffee shop, this place was pleasantly surprising.  A very California menu, with cucumbers in the water and fresh avocados on their tacos, this is a fantastic place to get very good food at very reasonable prices.    The service is always friendly, and their Happy Hour menu is one of the best bargains in town.   The Kobe burgers are a bargain anytime, but $3 off a $10 1/2lb Kobe burger in Old Town Scottsdale during happy hour is unheard of.
This is out Saturday morning breakfast place! We get the breakfast nachos and share as that is more food that one person can possible eat in one seating. Great service and friendly servers!

I went here for breakfast, ordered an omelette with potatoes and an English muffin. When my food came out it looked wonderful and I started to eat when I noticed a piece of blonde hair intertwined in the potatoes. Just a sidenote I have black hair and it definitely was not mine. The service was slow to begin with but I sat and waited for our server to come back so I could tell her and send it back however she didn't come back for quite a while so my husband went to find her to let them know, specially because he was already done with his meal at this time. Somebody came out took the plate and asked if I wanted another omelette, at that point I was too disgusted and I just politely said no thank you. The manager came out and he was polite and apologized and ask if there's anything at all that he can do for us at that point we said no were fine and we just wanted to leave so I asked if we could have our bill. Our server finally came back and we asked her for the bill and if I could order a coffee to go. That also Took a very long time to get to us. She then brought a second check out for the cup of coffee that I ordered for five dollars. I'm disgusted with the food with the service and the fact that they charged us for a cup of coffee which is the principal not the cost. Our meal was $26 without the tip and that was only for my husband's plate an ice tea and a side of bacon. They did take my meal of the bill ( as they should've) but this was A bad experience altogether. I will not go here ever again and it's too bad because we would frequent this place a lot. Never again!

We went here for the first time for lunch today. It is a great area with the outside patio right up front. We rode our bikes there and they had a small space for them. The patio is great, the food was great (I had biscuits and gravy plus 1 egg with sides of fruit and potatoes. They could have used more gravy buit that's because I am a pig!) My friend had the egg white veggie wrap and she loved it!). The water has a cucumber with appeals to me for some reason. The service was fantastic!! And this was noon on a Friday  in downtown Scottsdale, which is always packed on that day and time.  So they must have read all these other reviews and said "WTF!" We need to step up the service! Each of our bills came to under 9 bucks without tip. Biscuits and gravy without egg would have been 6.95. Compared to The breakfast Club, this place gets FIVE stars. Compared to my favorite place in Cave Creek, Oak Creeks Diner and Flapjacks, it gets 4 stars.  Will definitely go again!

A couple Sunday morning brunch's here, and I am sold.  Other than it's location, I can't say good enough things about it!  The drinks are awesome, the food is fabulous, and the staff is on top of their game.  I've had a few things on the menu, and I've been completely satisfied with each one of them.  My girlfriends that I have gone with rave about the omelets, if you are into the "egg" thing. :)  Really though, great place, sit on the patio if you can.

Stopped on for lunch prior to MSBL World Series workout on a Saturday afternoon. Wanted to catch up on some College football games. Got an Octoberfest beer and Citrus Avocado salad (half) topped with grilled turkey. Hit the spot.

They treated me like royalty. As a woman who often dines alone you can be treated like a second class citizen. They were so fast at my request as I had to get to a meeting. Don't know where they found such superb staff. Jessica was so sweet and so were the managers Alan and Jenlyn. What a pleasure to be treated so special. Thank you!

This place rocks for breakfast!!  I no longer live in Scottsdale and I miss the gingerbread pancakes- they are soooo good.  I am NOT a sweet breakfast-orderer either, so if I  miss pancakes then it means they are truly amazing.  I can honestly say this is the only place I've been to that I would ever order a type of pancakes for breakfast.  They're so good that putting anything on them (syrup or butter) just takes away from the amazing-ness of them. Their omelets are always fantastic, too.  My favorite here is the delicious caprese omelet and I've also had the veggie omelet which is fabulous.  Their breakfast menu is sooo great I wish I could go back and order everything.  Also, they serve breakfast all day!  Awesome bloody mary's, too.   Love it!!!

Came her today for a late brunch with the boyfriend.  This place is certainly busy and you should just expect to wait; there were only two of us so 20 minutes was what we were told.  I really liked that they provided coffee and water while we waited (although the water tasted terrible).  Once we were sat we were greeted by a really friendly waitress who was very attentive the whole meal, kuddos!  The mimosas here are really great, you can definitely tell the orange juice is freshly squeezed with just the right amount of pulp.  Food took awhile to get to the table but was worth the wait.  I ordered the chorizo mac n cheese and my boyfriend ordered the hickory ham eggs Benedict; my dish was tasty but I felt they skimped on the chorizo, the eggs Benedict was really delicious though!  The side of fruit that came with my meal was enormous and mostly delicious; I could tell that some of the watermelon pieces were beyond freshness.  Overall we had a really pleasant meal but I don't think I'd ever go out of my way to return.

Went to lunch here today and I loved it! It was cozy, my turkey burger was fantastic, and the service from Alejandro was excellent. I'd love to try breakfast but, alas, my time in Scottsdale is coming to a close. If you want simple, well-made food, DD is worth a stop.

I went here last Sunday for brunch with a girlfriend. The waitress was a little show to serve us, but it was packed and they did not chase us out when we lingered. The soy latte was delicious! The veggie omelette was also excellent... of course, it's the "DD Hash" I've completely fallen in love with.  I will be back!
The breakfast nachos are outstanding!  Great service, nice atmosphere, and the perfect place to squash a hangover while watching some college football.

As they say, "trust your gut" - your gut instinct is usually right... and while it's time for a DD update, it seems my gut instinct is still right on with this one.  Sine my initial visit, I've been to DD a handful of times, mostly out of convenience.    While my rating is staying the same, I will say that Daily Dose is consistent... they provide satisfactory food and service every time!  Portions are generous and the food is good; it just never blows me away...   One fun fact for you new moms out there: Daily Dose has a very large bathroom area with plenty of room to change your baby's diaper if necessary - I believe there were even diapers and wet wipes provided.  (This is probably because the owner has a little one).  I'm not at that stage of my life yet, so don't get any ideas, but good to know for those that are!

Other than the limited seating selection for outdoors, this place is underrated with breakfast club down the street. This place never had more than a 15 minute wait time, really good breakfast alcoholic drink selection as well as omelets and yogurt parfait. I definitely love this place; and it deserves a little more attention.

Great service fresh food tasty coffee lots of menu recommendations from staff.  I just love my breakfast food hot.  They deliver.  Pork chili omelette like nothing I've ever had before.  They slow roast the pork and add it to omelette and it was on my table 5 min after ordering.  Lisa was my server.  She was on her game for sure and friendly.

Breakfast, lunch, dinner...you pick it and you will be quite pleased.   Breakfast Pros:  DE-LISH! I've had their egg's benedict, mixed berry protein pancakes, and southwest wrap...I LOATHE hollandaise  sauce but I could not stop eating it and were cooked to perfection...I don't think Paula Dean could beat that.  The protein pancakes were amazing as well.  They have breakfast drinks too which are also quite scrumptious  Breakfast Cons:  On weekends, the wait is unreal...and when you wake up after fun night out in Old Town, you either go somewhere else where they will seat you sooner or cure your hangover with a few of their delicious bloody marys.  Dinner Pros:  Happy hour EVERYDAY during the summer from 4-8pm and it is really good.  Try any of their burgers (-$3 during happy hour) and you will be happy.  Chicken tacos are pretty amazing too and again super cheap during HH.  Dinner Cons:  Can sometimes get slow and isn't as much fun as weekend brunch but if you're with friends, it doesn't really matter cos the food and drinks are great.  Food gets: 4.5/5 Overall due to wait times:  4/5

Unknowingly, I drive past this establishment regularly on my trips down Scottsdale Rd. The signage is a bit weak from the road making it hard to find.  Upon arriving my party was immediately greeted and seated. Our server Jenine was very helpful in explaining the menu to my party.  The food did take a bit to come, but was well worth the wait. We started with the breakfast nachos. Quite a unique combination of chorizo, eggs, and cheese over chips.  I will be returning

I find myself bringing my family and friends who are visiting from out of town here for a meal. Their food is good, atmosphere inviting, and their drinks tasty. Each time I have dined here the restaurant manager has stopped by my table to ask how we are doing . You may also find him helping deliver plates. I always enjoy myself and will definitely be back. DD is typically busy on Sunday Funday for brunch, a testament to the restaurant's popularity.

This place was awesome! I've been in Scottsdale about a month now and have noticed that the service is not very good anywhere. The service here is incredible! They work as a team, our water was always full, food came out quick, and plates were cleared fast . Even with the fast service, we didn't even feel like we were being rushed out. The food was great, the biscuits and gravy were delicious, and the cinnamon roll pancake was also quite good. I tried the DD hash and did not like that, but it didn't take away from the experience at all. Our server Alexis was friendly and helpful.

One of my favorite spots for brunch on the weekend. The breakfast nachos are to die for, love how they come with a side of gravy. Also the cinnamon roll pancakes are awesome and great service. Really the only thing that is a fail at Daily Dose is their potatoes and sweet potatoes hash - both are pretty gross. Not sure why, flavors and textures are just off.

Awesome banana bread french toast, no need for syrup. Tip: get a savory side like turkey sausage to balance out the sweet. Gf is picky about her eggs, and our waitress saw that she didn't eat them and they asked to take them off the check. Great customer service.

This place has GREAT food, GREAT happy hour, and a really nice staff.  And they serve breakfast pretty much ALL DAY.  Pretty awesome by my standards.  The Hangover sandwich is a heart attack between two slices of bread, but it's so worth it.  The sausage is great, and the way the eggs drip into the sandwich...mmm....  Most of their breakfast dishes come with a side of fresh fruit, which we love because we can share it with the kids.  Oh, and the best part, in my opinion- the breakfast nachos...  I thought my sister and I were the only people in the world who ate nachos for breakfast, but no... the people at Daily Dose do it too, and they do it even better than I do!  Unfortunately we moved from Scottsdale, but we'll be making the trek from Tempe to fill our bellies here!  It's a new fave!  My only complaint is that it can be a bit slow at times...

Recommended to us by locals for brunch.  Great recommendation! Good selection of offerings, bountiful, tasty helpings, not too noisy so you can hear your table mates.  We had an assortment of sandwiches and salads - all fresh and nicely presented. Great place for breakfast/brunch.

Can't ever go wrong with the happy hour here. MY GAWD! Oh and to make it better, it is pretty much allll the time. Watch out for the frozen sangria though, it'll get cha! Take a seat on the misty patio, and service can be spotty, but nothing that my frozen sangria and a little portabella mushroom and brie fondue can't fix.... and its where the best people watching is!

My husband and I had brunch at daily dose this morning and the food was absolutely fantastic! Our waitress was less than attentive but there were a few other waiters that I could get their attention to help fill my water or get my bill but besides that it was great we will definitely be back. I had a delicious meat omelette and my husband enjoyed the sausage bowl, and we shared the cinnamon roll pancake which was to die for!!

I've been eyeing this little spot for a while now and finally made it in for a recent lunch. I really wasn't sure what to expect being in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale...you never know what you're going to get over there. The other customers were pretty typical: a variety of tourists and douchey young people recovering from their drunken night on the town. But the service and food were really quite impressive.   Their 7am to 4pm breakfast is pretty sweet and there were obviously many people there for that reason alone. The breakfast items I saw come out of the kitchen looked really tempting and I'm sure we'll be back to try some of them soon. We chose, however, to go with lunch that afternoon and were not disappointed. We started off with the Chips, Salsa, and Guacamole which was really good. We tend to be pretty picky about our guac and theirs was surprisingly delicious. For our main meals my husband ordered the Vegetable Salad Nicoise and I ordered the Caprese Grilled Cheese. Both were damn good and definitely worth ordering a second time.   I'm definitely looking forward to trying out the Daily Dose again. Their menu is huge and has seriously good looking options for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner. The atmosphere was decent too. The inside was pretty dark for a breakfast spot, but the patio was lovely.   Keep up the good work, Daily Dose, we'll be back soon!
We went for happy hour for a drink & some chips and dip. I had the ginger elixer cocktailthat was absolutely delicious -  a mix of ginger liqueur & champagne. Very cool ambiance & friendly staff!

I think I've found my regular brunch spot. Great portions, amazing food and drinks.. the only bummer is there can sometimes be a wait so you may want to get their early.  I recommend the strawberries and chocolate pancakes or the Cream Brulee Waffles and don't forget the Bloody Mary's!

The food is good and the portions are very generous. Not a big fan of the bloody marys but its a good spot to go to with your guy because they have TVs on the patio (and god forbid he miss his sunday sports).   Just be prepared to wait 30+ minutes on the weekend.
Average bar food. Extra large servings. Nothing to write home about.  Plenty of free parking and friendly wait staff.   3 stars because host (July 4) was not friendly at all.

Came here for lunch with my family. Sat on the patio and loved it. It had a great atmosphere. I got the mahi mahi tacos and they were probably the best fish tacos I've had in Scottsdale. Awesome. Server was nice as well. I would absolutely recommend this place.
Top Notch establishment!! This place takes breakfast to a whole new level. I highly recommend going In my opinion, the Good Egg doesn't never TOUCH this place ENJOY

This place is pretty tasty and has great happy hour specials!     The 2 high lights of my visit, imo, were the awesome chorizo mac'n'cheese and sitting on the small but nice patio. My chicken nachos were good too but I just kept stealing my friend's mac'n'cheese... next time, I know what to order!  Nice, clean, trendy atmosphere, and our server was nice and cute.    See ya there!

I loved the bar set up and semi dark atmosphere. It almost felt like sitting outside with string lights at night however, it was morning inside, Definitely kudos to the white light decorations. Pumpkin pancakes were excellent and hit the spot: -) service was extremely slow tho for having 2 tables and we ran out of all 3 of our drink orders, oj, mimosas and water...but other than that it was cool.
Good, but the salad was not as good as remembered.  Still think its a great spot in scootsdale!

Omg, our waitress Lyndsey was phenomenal, had great recommendations. The cinnamon roll pancakes were the best I've ever had and the cucumber Bloody Mary she suggested hit the spot! Of course the steak bowl is always delicious too. Great service, great food and drink, can't go wrong coming here!!

Long wait but worth it. Food was amazing.  A friend ordered the hash but very fatty so they accommodated a substitute.  This customer service is what keeps customers coming Back.  Thank you for a great experience

This place is a great lunch spot! We drive by all the time on the weekends when looking for a brunch spot but are always discouraged by the line out the door. Today we finally made it in for lunch and now we understand the line! I had the prime steak salad which was delicious, my BF had the gladiator burger which we also highly recommend. The portions were large which was also great. The craft brew selection was a nice way for us to try something new and had local beer on the menu which we obviously were happy about. All in all a perfect lunch date and we'll definitely be back.
This place is not good. I am sorry but the food is just blah, did ppl actually eat here before giving it 5stars?

Stopped in here after a long run in the morning on a weekend.  We waited for a patio table which took a little while-which we expected as this place looked packed every time we passed it during our trip.    Food 4.5/5 -We shared the hummus plate which was a little different than normal, not our favorite but still good -I had the chorizo benedict which rocked -My g/f had the southwestern breakfast wrap (not sure on the name) and it was BOMB!  Service 4.5/5 -No complaints, server was nice  atmosphere 5/5 -Right on N. Scottsdale ave, outdoor seating was very enjoyable, restaurant has a tidge of trendy/hipster but overall not overboard, just a nice place all together.  Prices aren't too bad either, you get a great meal for not too hefty of a bill.  Definitely going back

We went to the RnR first for some brunch. However, they were popping and we couldn't get a table foe an hour and a half. Lucky for us because we decided to walk .2 miles to this little Daily Dose of heaven. I was going to go healthy but then i saw the breakfast nachos.  So, so good. I would highley recommend and would come here again.

I will give this place a 5th star even though i wait for 30+ mins every time i go. that can only mean it's good right? Well, it's that friendly AND that good that i dont mind waiting. i hope it doesnt lose that customer service aspect that makes it so approachable.   best sausage gravy in town with a nice spice to it. i'm not fond of their potato has thingys... but their bfast nachos are fab and their white out omelette is also very tasty. my favorite item - turkey sausage eggs benedict... DD style (trade sausage gravy for hollandaise) - very filling as you can imagine.   breakfast club will still be the old town brunch location for when visitors come visit me but for week in and week out sunday morning brunch, this is my spot.

Big breakfast for a fair price! The line is nuts here on the weekends during spring training so we waited until Wednesday morning to go. We sat inside and there was something for everyone on the menu. The kids menu has huge portions as well, for $5 my son got a pancake, egg, fruit & turkey sausage. It was enough for an adult! I personally had the granola, fruit with almond milk, it was light and tasty. My husband had the applewood ham eggs Benedict with a side of fruit and loved it. I would highly recommend this place, but I understand if people aren't interested in waiting in line. The food & large menu will not disappoint. The location is perfect as well and walking distance to everything from Old Town, Scottsdale stadium and the mall.

Yum!  This was not my first time here and once again it did not disappoint.  Went for lunch today and it was fantastic.  Had the turkey sausage omelet with spinach and mozzarella and it was delicious.  The fruit that it came with was all ripe and sweet, which is not usually what I get at most breakfast spots.  Our server was super friendly and brought us all separate checks without us asking, which was greatly appreciated.  Looking forward to going back for happy hour sometime.

Best Corned Beef Hash EVER. Love the bit of zip added by the jalapeños. Why not add jalapeños to almost everything?  Great cup of joe and good service make this place a great Old Town Scottsdale best place for breakfast.

Delicious breakfast!  So many choices on the menu we will have to come back for sure!!!  Bacon is amazing, oatmeal was great, Crab Benedict was one of the best ever, lots and lots of crab.  Southwest wrap also was very high quality.
After eating breakfast at the hotel across the street, found this place, and ate here the next 4 days.  Lots of healthy options here, and I found the power bowl.  Except food and service.

Tied with Breakfast Club as my favorite place for Breakfast/Lunch in Scottsdale!  The breakfast Nachos are amazing! The Banana French Toast is amazing! The Green Chile Pork Omelet is Fan-F'ing-Tastic!  Probably my favorite of the 3!  Good comes out fast, prices are reasonable and the service was great.  If your looking for really good food in the Scottsdale area, you can't go wrong with Daily Dose!

This has always been my "go to" place for breakfast when I visit Scottsdale.  The location and the food are pretty good.  However, this morning I had a negative experience with pricing.  Hidden charges at restaurants are a pet peeve of mine.  Prices should be clearly written on the menu or explained before an order is placed.  I ordered a "straight shooter" breakfast that including "your choice of meat" for $9.  The waitress recommended the ham and I agreed.  I was surprised to see that the charge for my breakfast was $11.  I asked her why.  She didn't know why, so she asked someone else.  He told her it is because ham is $2 extra.  Apparently ham is not a "meat."  This is a rather unfortunate and dishonest way of doing business that happens all too frequently in restaurants.  I will not do business with places that are dishonest in their pricing because I often wonder what other dishonest practices they might have in order to increase profit.  I am in search of a new place to frequent when I am in Old Town Scottsdale.

Awesome variety on the menu paired with a great coffee menu makes this place my top spot for breakfast in old town Scottsdale.   Recommendations:  Meat and Cheese Omelette Eggs Benedict con Crab Cakes Mellow Bean coffee

This place was quite good! We went for breakfast and I ordered a mushroom and spinach omelet with potatoes, with the most amazing rosemary creme frishe (sp?). yuuummmmyy!!! My bf ordered one of the big burgers on the menu and said it was very moist but a little bland. The fries sweet potato fries were so good, especially with the creme frishe.
Our favorite lunch spot. The caprese grilled cheese is soooo good. Everything I've had is tasty. They have waffle fries! I always recommend it to people when they come.

If you're looking for a great breakfast/brunch place this is it We went on a Sunday and they were slammed. But the service was excellent as well as the food. It's very fast paced, almost like a diner, but if your waiter is busy someone else just jumps in and helps out. Amazing! And my strawberry chocolate chip pancakes with crispy bacon were delish!

This is my favorite resturaunt. I have been here for awhile but I have always enjoyed it. I first started going to this place when it first opened before it became super popular and I would go about 4 to 5 times a week. Amazing breakfast and lunch. Hangover sandwich is amazing when you wake up from a night of fun. The Gladiator burger is still one my favorite burgers, pretzel bun applewood smoked bacon just delicious. I also enjoy the Turkey wrap, my go to meal.  Parking can be a pain but worth it. The service has always been up and down. The turnover rate for servers was high in the beginning.

This is a friendly little place we like to visit for breakfast and lunch. Standard American fare but always done in a creative way. Service is always pleasant and attentive. It can get crowded and a bit noisy at times but you're never made to feel rushed. Parking in the area can be a bit difficult. For a small place the choices are diverse. I haven't had anything there that I didn't like. They know what they're doing.

Daily dose has a good menu and decent busy service.   I like the options on the menu because they are not the regular items you find at other breakfast places.   They have the traditional options  if you are interested.   They have outdoor seating for you and your puppies.

Reading the reviews, the 4 stars and along with a 35 minute wait for a table I was very excited going into Daily Dose. Wow was I disappointed! This is not one of those everyone has a bad day review. This place has problems. First when I walk in it really smelled like a Denny's, you know the smell! Our server thought there were 4 people coming so no service after the drinks arrived, I guess there were 4 menus on the table. All she needed was for ask, however lets give her a pass. Now for the real reason for the 1 star, the food, my pancakes were like cardboard, the fruit was stale and tasteless my ice tea was flavorless. The waffles were terrible and the omelets were tasteless! And through all this, the fire alarm went off 4 times.  Let me say something positive, the prices were reasonable.

By far the best burger and...the calamari- Amazing!!! Nothing like it in PHX! We used to find the comparable in San Diego. Having a son that is a chef, we know food that is prepared by someone who cares and Daily Dose certainly does! Will be back ASAP!!
The breakfast was fantastic. Had salmon Benedict DD style. Service was great as well. Will definitely come back.

I've only been here once and tried the Southwest Wrap. The Pork Chorizo in the wrap was the worst chorizo I have ever had in a $10 burrito. I'd be willing to try this place out again, but I definitely don't recommend the chorizo. Phoenix Sky Harbor has a better chorizo burrito.

Thank you to Check Please Arizona!   I saw Daily Dose on Check Please and just had to give it a try. Wow...the bust kept secret in Downtown Scottsdale for sure.   We arrived for lunch and actually got one of the last tables available. We were greeted warmly and our server took our drink order quickly. The menu is amazing! If there is not something on there that makes you quiver, then you must not be alive. My dining partner (out on our every Thursday lunch date) ordered the Grilled Chicken Cobb sandwich. She had pause as it's served on a Pretzel Bun. Oh girl please....hit the treadmill more in the morning! She was "blown away" loved, loved. loved her sandwich! I had the Turkey Burger. My felling is, if a restaurant is brave enough to put a Turkey Burger on their menu, they must know how to make it! They typically range from hockey pucks to bland indiscernible mystery substance. Not at the Daily Dose!!! Wow, Yumm, YAY!!!! is what my mouth was saying while devouring this burger! Such a great combination of flavors and yes, it's served on a pretzel bun as well...! The Combo Fries are the best. A combination of traditional russet potato fries and sweet potato fries. Such a great compliment to our sandwiches.   I can HIGHLY recommend The Daily Dose Old Town Bar and Grill. It's good service, GREAT food and very reasonably priced. So when you are near Scottsdale for Breakfast, Lunch, or Dinner, you owe it to yourself to head, no RUN to Daily Dose.

Umm...Banana Bread French Toast. That is all I have to say. This place ROCKS! The burgers and sandwiches are very good also. It is Scottsdale so the prices are probably 10% more than a similar place anywhere else. Great place to grab breakfast before a Spring Training game. Go Giants!

Visited this spot on a busy Saturday morning. There was a 15 minute wait which was okay but not a lot of room to wait inside, there were a few groups waiting and we were all a little crowded.  Sat at the bar and I agree with other reviews that the service was a bit slow, a lady with dark hair took my order and grabbed my drinks but I never saw her again until she brought the check, a runner from the kitchen brought our food and a different waiter checked on my group after we were eating. I got the fresh squeezed OJ which was really good and a great start to the morning! I ordered the Banana Bread French toasted with potatoes and a side of scrambled eggs. The french toast was very sweet and overfilled with pecans. The potatoes were pretty bland and looked frozen instead of fresh.  My scrambled eggs where perfect. It looked like they had a good selection of coffee, mimosas, and beer. I would come back for drinks and something basic but probably won't order any big item off the menu again.

The biscuits and gravy were delicious and so was the PB & J waffle (a must try). We also had the bacon Bloody Mary which had chunks of bacon in it. Adam was our server and he was efficient, quick and very friendly. Great service and food too!

Cool setting and vibe, good place to watch games. Lots of breakfast options and lunch too. I ordered the sirloin steak omelette which came with mushrooms, onions, and cheddar cheese a side of potatoes, and their butternut squash hash which was really good. The omelette was just okay. I also ordered a pomegranate green iced tea which was unfortunately super bland and I couldn't even taste any pomegranate which was a let down. I would come back to try a sweet breakfast option as the table next to us got some pancakes that looked really good!

Fast and friendly service during a busy lunch hour.   We come here every time we are in Scottsdale.  If you come for breakfast you have to try the banana bread French toast.   All I can say is WOW.   They also have a great happy hour with cheap eats and great drinks.

I had the gladiator burger for brunch which was a perfect med rare. The bacon was incredible along with all the cheese on the burger. The atmosphere was nice and the crowd was good as well. Worth your while if you're in Scottsdale.
Wow...    The Mixed Berry Pancakes are out of this world good.,,,  My Server Angie was the best :-)

A great breakfast spot.  Today's service was spot on. I love their coffee and their B. Mary's.   Banana bread French toast alone is a five star!  Perfect location in Old Town Scottsdale and a " favorite breakfast spot" 5 star review.

I finally got to give Daily Dose a try after a long night out in Old Town and it turned out to be just what the doctor ordered. We had a 30 minute wait for breakfast around 11am and it was well worth it. The free coffee they offer outside makes the wait a little more tolerable. When we finally got seated by the friendly host we enjoyed a nice outdoor patio hightop with a heat lamp keeping us warm. Everything on the breakfast/lunch menu sounded appetizing, but ultimately I went with the breakfast nachos. It was a pile of nachos with cheese, chorizo, scrambled eggs, and a side of sausage gravy. Not the healthiest of breakfasts, but a perfect hangover cure that tasted amazing. My girlfriend decided she was more in the lunch mood, so she opted for the Old Town Stack, which consists of shaved prime rib, swiss, horseradish mayonnaise & sweet onion slaw on a toasted pretzel sub roll. Also fantastic and I'd probably get it if I was here for lunch. She also went with the half regular and half sweet potato fries which got a thumbs up from us both. Check out the pics I posted to see what I'm talkin' about!  Overall, Daily Dose was a great food experience, except for the unbelievably obnoxious table of eight sitting nearby who laughed incredibly loud nonstop throughout the entire meal. Seriously, I've never seen or heard any table like it in my entire life. Such "rude and thoughtless little pigs." Everyone on that patio was annoyed with them. Not the restaurant's fault though I suppose.

I come here about once a month, favorite brunch place. A lot of food for cheap! Environment and staff are awesome. I've had Nick as a server for the past 4-5 visits and he's amazing. Thanks for always putting your customers first!

This place is a very chill wine bar. Came here after flying in for work and wanted something that would be light, have a good wine selection, and a nice outdoor patio/bar area. Daily Dose fulfills each of those items.   You MUST get the bruchetta plate.

The name of this restaurant MAY conjure up memories of big unfriendly pills being shoved down your throat after a bout of flu... but I hope that it will now take on new meaning considering the non-flu-like scrumptiousness that takes place here!   I stumbled upon reviews while looking up different breakfast joints in the Old Town area and I was impressed with the many menu options, so I took my friend here on a Saturday morning. We only sat waiting for about fifteen minutes, which was impressive. It's a big place and they have many seats.  So back to those MANY breakfast options: Hello Waffles! Hello Omelets! Hello HEALTH NUT OPTIONS? I am that person who stares at the healthier options at a breakfast joint, telling myself that it'll be good-- or at least not filled with regret and coma-inducing ingredients. Unfortunately, delicious breakfast food is typically sprinkled with these for the utmost flavor and enjoyment. So, with my egg white selected, when the server comes around, I blurt out "Eggs benedict!" every time...ultimately failing. (But never disappointing myself!) This time, I decided to take a leap of faith because of the following:   Roasted Turkey Sandwich House roasted turkey, corn salsa & red onion scrambled with three egg whites. Topped with chili cheese sauce & avocado served open faced on multigrain. Served with herb potato & fruit.  OK... I admit this has both cheese sauce and potatoes in it, so it's not EXACTLY an egg white omelet with spinach and mozzarella.
